594508704.name: Amaizing Water Park (new, clean and great service)
594508704.author: a TripAdvisor user
594508704.reviewBody:
I took my 3 kids during July 2018, to my surprise the place is a great water park; seems all new and very clean.
we expend around 6hours with a lot of fun. MUST GO.
220 pesos each person (aroun 11 dollars), they DO NOT RENT towells, so bring your (they do sell towells).
good food and verages availbale with reasanable cost.
this was the best activity for us at veracruz-boca del rio.

485087066.name: Great waterpark exceeding expectations
485087066.author: a TripAdvisor user
485087066.reviewBody:
Absolutely great.
Not too big, not crowded but has USA written all over it in style, comfort and ambience.
Economically priced as well.
Again is not a huge place but attractions are well designed with safety well in mind with design.
Only issue was attractions are not open throughout day, are opened one at a time which is unusual.
Good food (burgers were great) moderately priced, about $5 U.S. for a burger basket where Pepsi is King, no Coca Cola.
Good armed security with guarded parking area a plus.
Turn-offs:
Open 10 till 6
No leaving after entry without repay
Bring own towels
Absolutely no food or beverage allowed
Intermittent opening of attractions 
Lounge chairs very uncomfortable 
All in all is a great place to visit, we went 2 days in a row staying at Yes Hotel, poor communications between Hotel and Park although packages offered with both.
We're many issues with Hotel as well but will stay again.
With safety a grave concern in Mexico this waterpark is not a worry in the least and a great place to take the kids with adult attractions as well.
And expansion coming soon as well.
Well done Carlos Slim.

662230660.name: Amazing History here!
662230660.author: a TripAdvisor user
662230660.reviewBody:
The Malecon (Spanish for pier) in the port city of Veracruz has a great deal to see and do. You can see the oldest port in North America which is still heavily used today, try local delicacies (such as fresh fruits, tacos, and other tasty foods), and shop in the local shops where local artisans sell their wares. 

About a block from the Malecon is La Gran Parroquia, the oldest cafe in North America. Still standing in its original location, this coffee shop was opened in 1808, 54 years before the famous Cafe Du Monde opened in New Orleans, Louisiana. Here, you will be served strong coffee in a glass tumbler, to which a Lechero (milkman) will add hot milk by pouring it from high up from a large tea pot. This is served with cinnamon twists which come somewhat dry, because they are meant to be dipped into the coffee. There is often live music here, and the staff are very friendly and attentive. You can purchase bags of their ground coffee for 150 pesos for a 1/2 kilogram bag (about $10CAD). 

On the pier itself, there are a number of street vendors set up. They will call out to you (if you are Caucasian) "Guera!!" or "Guero!!" which is Spanish slang for white person - not intended to be an insult. You will also be able to see the Naval installation in the form of monuments, buildings, and the presence of Naval soldiers dressed in white uniforms. There are also boys who dive for sea shells and will sell them to you for a couple of pesos each.

656449087.name: Relax
656449087.author: a TripAdvisor user
656449087.reviewBody: Just arrive here with vessel and have a few hours yo kill on the city. Easy to reach from terminal. Stroll.around on this area enjoy the streets here\n Still plenty shop to buy local handicraft

631754419.name: nice walk and shopping
631754419.author: a TripAdvisor user
631754419.reviewBody: you can walk through Malecon day or night, there are places for pictures, shopping handycrafts, souvenirs, imports, entertainment (clowns, divers), and ship tours

601130555.name: Walk along the strand
601130555.author: a TripAdvisor user
601130555.reviewBody: A charming walk along the water. There are historical markers, statutes celebrating the various communities that have made Veracruz their home and food vendors. Access to public beaches is also available.

593894134.name: Sit and have a drink
593894134.author: a TripAdvisor user
593894134.reviewBody: Good place to find a table on the square and have a glass of wine.  Watch the locals walking around and hear the music from the street vendors or on stage.  Be careful with the people trying to sell you fake goods.  A simple no thank you keeps them away.

585107546.name: Way better than I imagined
585107546.author: a TripAdvisor user
585107546.reviewBody: By night is better with boat tours and nightlife, live music and just a fun place to let the kids run free, spent hours here just wandering.

571362182.name: Always full of life
571362182.author: a TripAdvisor user
571362182.reviewBody: I stayed in Malecon for about one month and the area is always bustling with street vendors and musicians. It\'s definitely a great place to just sit, relax and people watch.

550511116.name: Malec\u00f3n
550511116.author: a TripAdvisor user
550511116.reviewBody:
The place is very interesting and has a great view. 
You can observe the massive cargo ships.
There are several spots with street food (corn, esquites, ice cream, etc).
A lot of merchants selling souvenirs and local handcrafts (art pieces).
Unfortunately the whole towns city center was extremely dirty, which was very unfortunate and a nasty experience (horrid smells everywhere and streets flooded with rubbish).
Which overall didn’t make it inviting.

550477473.name: Close-up views of a working port, lots to see as you walk as far as you can along the water...
550477473.author: a TripAdvisor user
550477473.reviewBody: I fell in love with Veracruz\' Malec\u00f3n before I ever saw it \'live & in person\'; when watching Mar\u00eda Novaro\'s wonderful 1991 film, Danz\u00f3n. When I was able to visit, the walk along the waterfront did not disappoint. I love the sculpture honoring the port\'s engineers and dock workers, and most times of year it\'s possible to take a leisurely walk all the way to the aquarium, or the Agust\u00edn Lara museum, or even further south. It\'s also well worth going to the San Juan de Ulua fort/prison; on the way you see much more heavy-duty port activity. I also highly recommend John Todd Jr.\'s website on various aspects of life in Veracruz, with his lively accounts of the region\'s social history.

549468837.name: Uninteresting boardwalk
549468837.author: a TripAdvisor user
549468837.reviewBody: Came here on our first day. It is ok but lacks charm. It\'s a nicer walk if you keep walking after the boardwalk toward boca del Rio as it isn\'t as crowded and you have a beautiful view of the ocean and rocks. Nice way to kill some time.

515518314.name: Seaside walk
515518314.author: a TripAdvisor user
515518314.reviewBody: Walked several kilometers along the Malecon. It\'s fine but would be nice if they had more trees for shade.

513150610.name: Great Place To Stroll
513150610.author: a TripAdvisor user
513150610.reviewBody: This is a great place to take a walk anytime of the day or night. There are excellent views of the port and street vendors all over the place.

506329356.name: Must go to place in Veracruz
506329356.author: a TripAdvisor user
506329356.reviewBody: It\'s a nice location for a stroll in the hot months of summer, it\'s great to go with family! They have a lot of curio shops.

496336663.name: Great place to people watch.
496336663.author: a TripAdvisor user
496336663.reviewBody: Our hotel was smack in the middle of the Malecon so my wife and I grew very intimate with the pulse of this area. The Malecon reeks of history and contains interesting buildings, statues, cafes, and curio shops. It\'s where you can board the famous double-decker tour buses and the boats that tour the harbor.

494643919.name: People watch
494643919.author: a TripAdvisor user
494643919.reviewBody: I stayed at the Emporio, so I had a good view of everyone on the waterfront. Was very popular, but not much to look at. One night, there was a kid using a green laser to blind people (including me), so that wasn\'t fun.\nInteresting buildings, Navy, Pemex, Emporio.

484886147.name: Enjoyable, bout all Veracruz had to offer
484886147.author: a TripAdvisor user
484886147.reviewBody: Waterfront with huge shipping container boats in harbor.  Nothing special but this and zoology bout all VC has to offer

481327241.name: The malecon (heart of the city!)
481327241.author: a TripAdvisor user
481327241.reviewBody: The Malecon is a great place to people watch and soak in the local music and culture which is unique to Veracruz.  There are a multitude of restaurants and coffee shops with sidewalk caf\u00e9 style seating.  The adjacent park offers a different type of band or other entertainment every night of the week.\nThe setting is very colorful and rich with locals there to enjoy the cultural heart of the city.  Many museums and historical sights are within an easy walking distance of the Malecon.  Sit back, relax and enjoy the rich experience of song, food, and dancing!

479265396.name: Really interesting place to enjoy local culture
479265396.author: a TripAdvisor user
479265396.reviewBody: I had the chance to take a walk through the neighborhood at night, there was many people in the streets, many dinning options, local music, and the most curious: Boys diving from the docks to look for a coin that you throw. (WOW) At night. (WOW) Not sure it\'s safe for them (they are just teenagers), and that\'s why I didn\'t want to participate, but still it was interesting.

467679274.name: Typical Tourist trinkets
467679274.author: a TripAdvisor user
467679274.reviewBody: You have to go. You will walk by the Malecon because it is right in the center of everything.  The shops are staffed by locals selling the typical tourist stuff.  Always fun to look.

463922859.name: Good for an even stroll.
463922859.author: a TripAdvisor user
463922859.reviewBody: A very nice place for an evening stroll.  Stay away from the edge of the pier though if you are not a swimmer.

460534166.name: Wonderful
460534166.author: a TripAdvisor user
460534166.reviewBody: Beautiful view! Very peaceful. It\'s a Thursday and it\'s not much action; according to locals the weekend is when there is more sidewalks vendors. Because it\'s by the beach it can get cold, specially in the late afternoon to evening (bring a light sweater). You will encounter a few young man who will ask for your loose change and ask you to throw it into the ocean water. They will dive and get your pesos; which they will keep. Some will say I will dive and get you a live star fish or some kind of small sea creature. Bring your pesos! They are all very energetic and this is just a way for them to get money. If your not interested just be respectful and keep walking. The street vendors will offer you perfumes, sunglasses, traditional candies and your typical souvenirs. As far as safety, it\'s very safe!! We saw lots of police enforcement while we walked.

455426938.name: Beautiful!
455426938.author: a TripAdvisor user
455426938.reviewBody: Amazing! My family and I fell in love with Veracruz! The malec\u00f3n has so much to see! it\'s is amazing!

454111530.name: Nice but not spectacular
454111530.author: a TripAdvisor user
454111530.reviewBody: The Malecon is very pretty, mostly a historical Boardwalk. Don\'t get me wrong it is a must see but does not compare to the other things Veracruz has to offer.

453230795.name: Entertaining
453230795.author: a TripAdvisor user
453230795.reviewBody: It is entertaining to visit.  With all the market shops and the view of the ships.  This is good when military ships dock.

446066627.name: A must visit
446066627.author: a TripAdvisor user
446066627.reviewBody: This is a very wide sidewalk banked by water on one side and restaurants, hotels and shops on the other.  At one end are numerous souvenir shops.  Great place to visit on a nice day.

442751755.name: Average Malecon
442751755.author: a TripAdvisor user
442751755.reviewBody: I love malecons but this didn\'t have very nice views, but it is still great to walk along and enjoy the ocean breeze.

440023424.name: Great place to go
440023424.author: a TripAdvisor user
440023424.reviewBody:
This Is definitely really nice Malecon
You can take great pictures and enjoy the view. It is clean and well maintained. 

You have to see it

439156339.name: One face of Mexico
439156339.author: a TripAdvisor user
439156339.reviewBody: Mexico is not an homogenous country, it has many regions, many faces. Veracruz it\'s just one of them, and El Malecon is the best way to approach to this rich area.

430967483.name: Malecon de Veracruz
430967483.author: a TripAdvisor user
430967483.reviewBody: Their is a joy watching people just hanging out and walking . You will enjoy one of the most traditional things the Veracruzanos enjoy just walking and chatting while enjoying a cool breeze and best of all is free

420214659.name: A lot of history
420214659.author: a TripAdvisor user
420214659.reviewBody: downtown Veracruz has a lot of  history, visit malecon and cathedral, you can walk within distance and very beautiful at nights.

418998510.name: Used to be a nice place to stroll and see the ships in the harbor.
418998510.author: a TripAdvisor user
418998510.reviewBody: I have no idea what happened, but when we went this past February, the smell was extremely unpleasant, so we ended up going somewhere else.

403422181.name: Great place to stroll, eat and shop
403422181.author: a TripAdvisor user
403422181.reviewBody: The title says it all...tons of gift shops and places to eat. Fun to watch the huge barges with thousands of containers moving around.

397470715.name: Beautiful Relaxing
397470715.author: a TripAdvisor user
397470715.reviewBody: We enjoyed the Malecon.  It was relaxing with a great positive energy. Our daughters enjoyed running and chasing one another in the big open spaces.

381493124.name: Trinkets and People Watching
381493124.author: a TripAdvisor user
381493124.reviewBody:
I'm a little surprised by all the positive reviews.  The Malecon is worth a visit if you are in town.  It is an outdoor market (clothes, trinkets, keychains, etc.).  You can also see the fort from the pier, some big barges might be docked there, and the original Gran Cafe de la Parroquia is right across the street.  If you go it can be fun to people watch, do a little shopping, and get a bit to eat.  Maybe even throw a 10 pesos coin in the the water and watch the kids dive for it.    

I would not recommend either the bus tour or the water tours to the fort.  Entrance to the fort is by car, the boat rides will only take you up close to the fort.  The bus rides to see the historic sites in the city are depressing, to say the least.  None of the historic sites are well cared for, with the exception of San Juan de Ulua.  But all the places you'll see on the bus tour are run-down and beaten up.  Plus the buses are all open, so if it's a hot day then you'll just suffer in traffic, sweating and puffing on exhaust fumes.

But the Malecon itself is worth a visit, go for a stroll, and maybe get a bite to eat at a nearby establishment.

358345168.name: Wind wind and more wind
358345168.author: a TripAdvisor user
358345168.reviewBody:
While in veracruz a walk in the malecon Is a must attraction. 

You can see Pemex  tower, the lighthouse and in the far end the ulua fortress.

350668675.name: Visit to the harbour and buildings
350668675.author: a TripAdvisor user
350668675.reviewBody: We walked from our hotel to visit the harbour and the nice historic buildings. On the Sunday\'s the local people walking with there family,s on the piers. You can take a boat trip or bustour. In the evening there is an open lighted bus tour.

345298356.name: Great for a Stroll and Selfies :D
345298356.author: a TripAdvisor user
345298356.reviewBody: Great sights of buildings and statures and the crazy Veracruz sign at edge of dock. plus plenty of street vendors to browse, and some boat tours also. and threre is even an abandoned prison fort on the other side of the channel, need to catch trolly trian etc.. just ask concierge, or a local. plus some nights are celebrations on the malecon block.

344835479.name: nice place to walk
344835479.author: a TripAdvisor user
344835479.reviewBody: The malecon is at its best in the evening when lots of people come there for a stroll. There is a lot of amusement with sellers and street artists. You have a good view on the activity of the port

337559989.name: The best place to go
337559989.author: a TripAdvisor user
337559989.reviewBody: It\'s awesome, you can enjoy a great view of ships as well as the sea. It\'s great to  walk calmly with the family, couples or friends. At night is full of handcraft shops where you can buy local products.

334330969.name: If you go to Veracruz you must go there.
334330969.author: a TripAdvisor user
334330969.reviewBody: This is one of the traditional places. Look for the guys that are by the port, you throw a coin to the sea and they get it. It\'s so cool. Buy an elite and walk around the malecon

333531228.name: Love the Malecon
333531228.author: a TripAdvisor user
333531228.reviewBody: Every time we visit Veracruz we walk there to eat and to people watch. There is always something going on, even the big ships in the port are interesting.

332025995.name: El bar mas grande del planeta
332025995.author: a TripAdvisor user
332025995.reviewBody: Lovely boulevard when the weather allows it! \nA place for locals to gather and party on the street, lovely views from the Ulua prison and the Gulf of Mexico

330002193.name: AMAZING
330002193.author: a TripAdvisor user
330002193.reviewBody: Veracruz, Veracruz (Malecon) Is one of the most amazing views anyone can see, If you have the chance to go onto the Tour Bus, You will not reget it. It tells you and shows you the story behind this amazing place and breathtaking beaches!

317432473.name: Very lovely walking area
317432473.author: a TripAdvisor user
317432473.reviewBody: Veracruz did an excellent job on its malecon. It is lovely to walk around day or night. In the evening the vendors come out with their wares. The area has a very safe feel as there are police around and there does not appear to be much riff raff. We were pleasantly surprised.

310555512.name: Veracuz\' Boardwalk
310555512.author: a TripAdvisor user
310555512.reviewBody: Strolling the malecon was very nice, and we enjoyed the views of the port, the shops, and the sculpture pieces that are located along the way.  There were lots of Mexican families enjoying the malecon along with us.  See it at night too!

309658275.name: crowded and smelly from the ships
309658275.author: a TripAdvisor user
309658275.reviewBody: Lots of people selling the same wares, crowded and did not feel very safe. Bathroom facilities are not available.

298877200.name: Clean and nice for a walk
298877200.author: a TripAdvisor user
298877200.reviewBody: Is a nice walk in the afternoon, but in some places it smells bad, the merchandise there is all from China, nothing worth to buy, you need to visit the antiques shops to purchase real handmade \u00edtems.

277631871.name: Beautiful
277631871.author: a TripAdvisor user
277631871.reviewBody: I visited el Malecon when I was very young, and I have absolutely great memories of it.  Can\'t wait to bring my boys so they can experience the same.

277364144.name: Nothing more than a part of the port
277364144.author: a TripAdvisor user
277364144.reviewBody: Nothing special. It\'s basically an extension of the port. Not restaurants, no bars, a few ships (no old ones). Basically a bare area.

275345817.name: Pretty but dirty and smelly
275345817.author: a TripAdvisor user
275345817.reviewBody: There\'s got to be a way to control the sewer smell at El malecon. It\'s supposed to be a touristy place but I promise you won\'t want to come back after you get the smell...

264289494.name: A Lovely Stroll
264289494.author: a TripAdvisor user
264289494.reviewBody: The Veracruz malecon is a nice stroll down a wide walkway in downtown Veracruz.  It goes right along the port, so you can see all sorts of interesting action going on.  It actually goes for quite a distance, but I didn\'t go all that far.

258687985.name: Strolling along
258687985.author: a TripAdvisor user
258687985.reviewBody: What a beautiful relaxing way to exercise after a big meal.  People stop to talk to you about their beautiful city/port

257354462.name: Great for a run or walk
257354462.author: a TripAdvisor user
257354462.reviewBody: The malecon in Veracruz is a really nice for a walk or run. Really long and accessible and nice views of the town and pier. Nice jetty in the middle to run out along to have great views back on the city.

249425701.name: Paseo el Malecon, Veracruz
249425701.author: a TripAdvisor user
249425701.reviewBody: Having travelled to Veracruz on a fairly regular basis since late 1963 I really like just walking the "Malecon", taking in the sights, the souvenir shops, the vendors selling "native" articles, the people promenading in the evenings and on weekends. A cup of coffee and breakfast at the "Paroquia". The Pemex building, the Naval Academy, the cadets parading. At some point in the 1980\'s I started staying in a hotel on the Malecon. It is well worth an afternoon or evening.

236977180.name: Nightly Stroll
236977180.author: a TripAdvisor user
236977180.reviewBody: I love to stroll the Malecon, especially Saturday and Sunday nights. Families out enjoying the ocean breeze, walking their pets. Impromptu entertainment. \n\nOne of the best free things to do in Vera Cruz.

232894657.name: Typical Veracruz
232894657.author: a TripAdvisor user
232894657.reviewBody: Good for tourist attractions and typical gift purchasing. Great coffee shop "La Parroquia".  Fun but very hot "Artesanias/market" site.

226767924.name: an excelent place for a walk
226767924.author: a TripAdvisor user
226767924.reviewBody: if you like walking than the malecon is a great place to do it. we like to stroll along and look at the boats and ships in the harbour and people watch! There\'s always lots to look at and lots of people selling just about everything!!! The place is kept quite clean. Not too long ago they had a wonderful display of large photographs of different places and things around and typical of Veracruz but the last time we visited quite a few of them had been damaged and hadn\'t been removed or replaced yet. That was the only draw back that I can think of. As you stroll you\'ll get a nice breeze off of the ocean, although not a great place to walk when there\'s a "norte"(strong wind)

223049696.name: From Veracruz to Boca del Rio
223049696.author: a TripAdvisor user
223049696.reviewBody: The first time I went to Veracruz I drove by, and the second time I took the tour bus. Well, I liked both. \nI really felt like I was "at the beach" because of the beach side restaurants and hotels. \nOne of my favorite things about "El Malec\u00f3n" is that it goes from Veracruz to Boca del Rio, about 3 miles long.

210663456.name: Great Malecon
210663456.author: a TripAdvisor user
210663456.reviewBody: The beach is great down near the Aquarium , But the vendors are NOT Cheap Beer is 5.00 dlls thats alittle steep seeing there is trash everywhere.\n

206849844.name: The Best of Veracruz
206849844.author: a TripAdvisor user
206849844.reviewBody: Veracruz doesn\'t have great beaches, but it does have a great Malecon. Terrific if you want to get out for a leisurely stroll and see a port town at work. Definitely a must if you are in town.

202915096.name: The Waterfront is the heart of the city
202915096.author: a TripAdvisor user
202915096.reviewBody: The Malecon and the Zocolo are the heart of the city. As the largest port in Mexico the waterfront is key to everyday life. there are markets, hotels, restaurants, and great views. Don\'t miss this if you are in Veracruz. Better Beaches as you head to the Boca del Rio area.

202692282.name: A great way to see the city.
202692282.author: a TripAdvisor user
202692282.reviewBody: The best part about the malecon was that you could walk about 5 miles one way and not have to cross traffic at any point. So it really is great for those who are used to a long stroll or run. We did about 8 miles walking, round trip. We stayed downtown, and it was great to see all the fancier hotels that line the waterfront. You get to an area where you come to the seafront restaurants. Avoid being tackled by menu toting touts. See how long you can stand being called "amigo" by them all. They may even gently grab your arm to lead you into their eating establishments. Just keep walking. That is what the malecon is there for.

200933165.name: Seashore walk...
200933165.author: a TripAdvisor user
200933165.reviewBody: It is a pleasure to walk through the Malec\u00f3n of Veracruz. It is beautiful. The sea and all that goes along the buss of the city. They have recently added spaces for work out. You can walk from the Haven (harbour port) to Boca del R\u00edo just sensing the sea in all it\'s splendour and making more space to eat and taste the flavours of the city.

200410619.name: Great for a walk
200410619.author: a TripAdvisor user
200410619.reviewBody: Great for an early or late walk, great views, easy parking right next to malecon, many restaurants=on the malecon side ant the street side.

200035771.name: Nice visit by boat
200035771.author: a TripAdvisor user
200035771.reviewBody: We stayed at the Emporium hotel and took advantage of taking a tour of harbor where you can see the malecon.\nit is 45 minutes ride but you could experience nice views including famous San Juan Ulua fort.

196061934.name: Great views as you walk.
196061934.author: a TripAdvisor user
196061934.reviewBody: If you are looking to take a stroll with beautiful views or wanting to buy tourist gifts, this is the place to go.  At night, it is alive with people.

193685455.name: good way to get to downtown from the southern beach
193685455.author: a TripAdvisor user
193685455.reviewBody: it\'s not as pretty as the malecon in Puerta Vallarta, which is to be expected given that Veracruz is a big port.  Also, we were first there on a sunday night on a 3 day weekend and there were too many people for our taste.  But on subsequent nights it wasn\'t as crowded and was a good way to walk from our hotel near the southern end of the beach to the downtown area.  Also, the Mercado de artesanias was good and along the way.

193006381.name: Where Everyone Came Ashore
193006381.author: a TripAdvisor user
193006381.reviewBody: and people still gather to see and be seen while enjoying the port, the beaches and the water.  There is a powerful new (November 2013) monument marking 100 years of Jewish immigration to Mexico.

192855237.name: Great place to exercise
192855237.author: a TripAdvisor user
192855237.reviewBody: Used the Malecon daily to exercise off the previous days great food.  Enjoy the sights and the fresh sea air.

192177432.name: Great exercise with a view.
192177432.author: a TripAdvisor user
192177432.reviewBody: We spend many hours walking the Malecon between Veracruz and Boca del Rio.  On the weekends there are endless booths selling all sorts of food and gifts.  In the morning and early evening many people run, skate, and walk for exercise and you can stop along the way and use some of the outside exercise equipment.

190784007.name: a fine walk
190784007.author: a TripAdvisor user
190784007.reviewBody: good work out a long walk many people selling there wears a fine view of  water craft & naval ships enjoyed the view

188997443.name: Interesting but too many vendors
188997443.author: a TripAdvisor user
188997443.reviewBody: If you lie ports and large ships this is a great location.  The port is one of the nicest and busiest in the world.  Walking on the malecon in the cool evenings is relaxing and affords nice views.  There are too many vendors though.  I understnad the need for tourist "recuerdos" but too many takes away the enjoyment of the location.

188623555.name: Just a bunch of tourist traps.
188623555.author: a TripAdvisor user
188623555.reviewBody: Okay, but not exceptional. The merchandise is not remarkable for price or quality. There are some pretty views of the ocean. Some neat statues. That\'s all.

185909638.name: busy busy place
185909638.author: a TripAdvisor user
185909638.reviewBody: Everything is going on on the Malacon.  Food, vendors, music, dancing, laughter, bus tours and boat tours leave from there.\nIt\'s a very interesting place to hang out.

177561534.name: small
177561534.author: a TripAdvisor user
177561534.reviewBody:
There are a few things to do, you can take the tourist bus o see the shipyard o the handcraft market. 

There is the "Cafe la parroquia", and a few hotels, the Pemex tower but there are no other options.

A good place to walk with your girlfriend and an ice cream

169675184.name: Too much great food
169675184.author: a TripAdvisor user
169675184.reviewBody: You have to stay up late to really enjoy the local music surrounding the area. Explore off the beaten path a bit, it is all safe, and find some local places to have good food.

168225671.name: Nice place to visit
168225671.author: a TripAdvisor user
168225671.reviewBody:
Firstable I´m not a person that likes crowds very much, This was the only turn down for me, there´s so many people selling artisanies in the evening that I got a little bit stressed.  On the lighter side you can find a lot of street performers (from living statues to Mariachi bands).
You can see the ships docking, loading or unloading any hour of the day, it is a really busy port!!!

I enjoyed the sunrise, I used "El malecon" to excercise in the morning, Sunrise was a spectacle to me.

167555016.name: Busy during the day, comes alive at night
167555016.author: a TripAdvisor user
167555016.reviewBody: This is a seaside town and the natives and tourists alike - nearly all of whom are Mexican, not many international visitors - converge on the Malecon and Zocalo. It\'s a lot of fun and appropriate for the whole family.

163863974.name: What a stroll
163863974.author: a TripAdvisor user
163863974.reviewBody: This was a joy to stroll along, morning, noon (a bit hot) and evening. Here you can take a ferry across to the fort, or take a tourist ferry. There are many coffee shops and other places of enjoyment. Relly good.

162469082.name: Nice place by late afternoon or night
162469082.author: a TripAdvisor user
162469082.reviewBody: Music, cheap local issues made by shells at the Artisans place, polo shirts with local & slang funny words

160487495.name: boring
160487495.author: a TripAdvisor user
160487495.reviewBody: seriously, nothing to do here. not sure why this is even referenced. there a number of statues, but the malecon overlooks the ugly industrial port.

158279804.name: Fun place to visit
158279804.author: a TripAdvisor user
158279804.reviewBody: Visit the little tiendas that lead to the malecon. However, after a while it seems like they all sell the same thing. The street bands were great and the large cafe served great coffee. It is a festive area to hang out in.

154517370.name: Beautiful place
154517370.author: a TripAdvisor user
154517370.reviewBody: Think New Orleans Market square, beautiful, but very crowded and a little dirty. They have live bands often, and  you will get hit up by every street vendor. Kindly say "No gracias" and all will be well.

148922191.name: Wonderful place for a stroll.
148922191.author: a TripAdvisor user
148922191.reviewBody: Lots of fun little shops, carts and stands. Across from 204 year old cafe worth a visit to. Fun boat tour of the harbor. Very helpful people who will help you park and watch (and even wash) your car while you out and about.

148753566.name: Little walk along the water.
148753566.author: a TripAdvisor user
148753566.reviewBody: It\'s an ok place. It\'s not like the boardwalks in USA. This is the latin style. Little tianguis (like fleamarket) and if you keep walking towards the zocalo (plaza where the Governmental palace is) you\'ll find the mercado of artesanias where you can buys some souveniers. The malecon doesn\'t have the typical park benches, so people just keep walking around.  I think it\'s nicer to walk alongside the beach near the Aquarium area, where there are a few casual bungallows where they serve fresh seafood.

148009286.name: A must if you visit Veracruz
148009286.author: a TripAdvisor user
148009286.reviewBody: Great afternoon/evening place to visit, you can go and see historical places, steamers coming in and out the port with a lot of places to go eat, see and shop.

147566952.name: Nice bustling water-front ...
147566952.author: a TripAdvisor user
147566952.reviewBody: A nice place to stroll among the locals and eat some traditional Mexican treats!!\n\nDuring the summer the breeze at night helps keep the heat down as well ...

147238866.name: The Lighthouse again.
147238866.author: a TripAdvisor user
147238866.reviewBody: Out front on the Malecon they had go-cart racing this passed week. There is usually always something going on for enteraniment durning the night.

146106266.name: calm and peaceful
146106266.author: a TripAdvisor user
146106266.reviewBody: Very nice place to walk in the ocean breeze.  Many sites to see, but especially interesting is the variety of vessels in the Mexican Navy.

144669708.name: Appreciated visit
144669708.author: a TripAdvisor user
144669708.reviewBody: Visited here with Quest for Adventure cruise ship, local people gave us a wonderful welcome on the quayside as we were the first cruise ship of the season and they have seen very few cruise ships in the last couple of years due to bad publicity ( there was a murder in the city centre on the day we were there).  The melecon is very close to the cruise ship and is an easy walk.  I went on a coach trip to La Antigua and Cempoal, not very interesting!\nWhen our ship left the quay were given a lovely send off, a band playing and local dancing and lots of people waving

137017191.name: over rated area full of tourist touts.
137017191.author: a TripAdvisor user
137017191.reviewBody: compared to the Malecons of Cuba and europe this is a fizzer... with nowhere to sit and crowded with sales people selling useless paraphilania and junk.  Do it once and you will not desire to do it again.

135002393.name: Fun place to get some exercise and people watch!!
135002393.author: a TripAdvisor user
135002393.reviewBody: Just get on it and start walking!!! You will even see a place where they have exercise equipment that anyone can use for free. There are plenty of little stands to buy some snacks, as well as reataurants. Remember the freshest and in my opinion, best seafood is here!!! Go for a walk or a jogg in the evening and you won\'t be disapointed . We love this place !!

134152696.name: Not on Par with Other Malecons in Mexico
134152696.author: a TripAdvisor user
134152696.reviewBody: Very "low rent" version of a malecon - Asphalt-covered walkway that runs along the harbor where the transport ships move in and out

131446976.name: a great place to walk
131446976.author: a TripAdvisor user
131446976.reviewBody: this is a wonderful place to stroll in the evening.  people are out in the cooler air, families, couples and kids.  vendors set up their wares.  there is a harbor cruise--80 pesos--not a lot to see that you can\'t see from the dock, but kids might like it.  it is nice on a hot day or warm evening.  there is also a trolley tour-30 pesos for 45 miniutes around the city---Spanish only, but again, a nice way to keep cool on a warm evening.  sit on the top so that you can really appreciate the architecture of the city and get a feel for the city street life.  this is a working harbor, not a tourist attraction.  you will see cargo ships and miliary craft.  remember, it has been a port of entry for 500 years.

128281957.name: Good place to walk
128281957.author: a TripAdvisor user
128281957.reviewBody: It is a great place to take a walk or do some exercise.  Has a very good view, and good restaurant options.

128203245.name: Exciting
128203245.author: a TripAdvisor user
128203245.reviewBody: When my husband along with my 9th old twins and myself wanted to have some fun we hopped a bus down the block from the CasaMarriott and headed to the malecon(boardwalk)boy did we have a blast. This is a 2 mile boardwalk with great stores, restaurants and just tons of fun. locals are building "Sand Art", there was music playing, people dressed in beautiful customs and you can pose to take pictures. They ask for no money but you can leave a little donation in the box they leave in front. I also found at the end of boardwalk a small flea market that had better prices then some ofbthe stores. All in all we had a blast and very SAFE.

125603171.name: Faro Venustiano Carranza
125603171.author: a TripAdvisor user
125603171.reviewBody: The history of Veracruz is reflected through its buildings. This construction saw pass all the events of the last century.

123455795.name: A peaceful walk with a harbor to see
123455795.author: a TripAdvisor user
123455795.reviewBody: Start at the zocalo and walk two blocks towards the harbor along the cathedral side . You will come to the many sidewalk stands that sell everything from t-shirts to cigars. Walk to your right and soon the Malecon will appear with more street vendors on your left and a large street boulevard on your right.  The malecon is extremely wide and smooth to walk on.\nLook to the right and you will see the famous restaurant Parroquia as you begin your walk. Further up you will see the open air tour buses and for about 60 pesos you can hop on and enjoy a city tour for 45 minutes. Across from the tour buses you will see harbor tour boats and for about a 100 pesos you can sight see the harbor or visit the Island of Sacrifices. check out the divers who will dive and swim for your peso thrown in the water. my wife and I walked to the aquarium from the tour bus stand in just under an hour. We saw numerous points of interest, fishermen bringing in sharks, ships entering the harbor, and numerous park benches along the way. Take some water along with you and if it\'s a hot day only go in the early morning or later toward evening. There are many taxis along the  Malecon for a ride back.

89692651.name: Go for a nice walk
89692651.author: a TripAdvisor user
89692651.reviewBody: The previous writer did have a bad experience with a restaurant along the malecon but also did not really give a review of the malecon. Like some other cities in Mexico the malecon is a wide seaside walkway that follows along the coast. We walked from its start to just a bit past the acuario (aquarium) which was at least a one mile walk (about 2 kms). Start where the city joins the harbor across the street from the huge Gran Cafe coffee house and just keep walking. At the start you will pass a long line of tourist venders selling jewelry, T-shirts, and typical trinkets. Keep walking and you will pass the old light house (Faro) and the Pemex Tower (oil company). The sidewalk turns as you pass the Pemex Tower and just keep walking along in that same southerly direction. Soon you will be away from the center of Veracruz but just keep on walking. The sidewalk is used by many and at all times of the day. You will pass many homes, businesses, and hotels but all of them will be on the opposite side of the street so you have a nice view of the water. Soon you will no longer be along the harbor but along the Gulf of Mexico proper. Yes, the palapa restaurants pop up after a while and you can walk on the sand if you prefer. And after a mile or a bit more you will come to the large complex that houses the aquarium and more. Later that day we did visit the aquarium but first we walked past it and crossed the street and caught a local bus that went all the way to Boca del Rio which was several miles away. You will pass many beach front hotels and restaurants and shops and eventually you will reach the touristy Boca del Rio area where you will find even more hotels and restaurants, a large shopping center, and, of course, a river which explains the name of this suburb. We got off our bus at that point and caught a bus going back towards Veracruz, got off at the aquarium, and had a great couple of hours there. Of course, we could have gone shopping or had a meal in Boca too. Back to the malecon- there seemed to be people walking along in the part of it that was close to Veracruz. The closer to Veracruz and the more people who were out for a walk. Just out for a stroll, jogging, or walking their dog. We were surprised how many were out for evening strolls too, especially couples.

37323065.name: Never eat at the restaurants on the beach- No coman en los restaurantes del malecon
37323065.author: a TripAdvisor user
37323065.reviewBody: Me and my husband had a terrible experience at the restaurants on the beach, there were a lot of waiters outside the restaurants inviting people to enter their restaurants, so we did. They gave us a menu without prices and at the end we received a ridiculous huge bill for what we ate, we were aware of the prices in other places and there was no way the prices were right. A taxi driver told us later that those restaurants always try to take advantage on tourists and adviced us to go to the restaurants where the locals eat.

671028560.name: Amazing Place
671028560.author: a TripAdvisor user
671028560.reviewBody: This was an amazing visit, I recommend hiring a tour guide to know the history of the place, which is very interesting, it is very hot and humid. the structure of the place is open and is not on a single level, there are stairs and small bridges.

664626006.name: My first trip without my parents
664626006.author: a TripAdvisor user
664626006.reviewBody: They say that to remember is to live again and I believe that if every time I remember this trip I am filled with joy even if only a couple of hours were the best in my life. The very good atmosphere, although a bit dirty and expensive, is very good to spend with family or friends on that occasion. It was all very fun because we still did not have so many worries about life. The seas are the most beautiful places you can visit and of course more Veracruz with such kindness of people that make you feel part of there. There is a wide variety of stalls and hotels that offer a great sevice of quality for any type of trip. I highly recommend this place and consider that we must first know all our beautiful country before judging or leaving to other countries...

660012582.name: History at its best
660012582.author: a TripAdvisor user
660012582.reviewBody: When you realize that Veracruz is turning 500 years old this May 3rd. maybe you can understand what a stunning place San Juan de Ulua is.The history surrounding every wall, the fights against the pirates, the defense of the city, even the prison itself, Amazing

658568704.name: Juarez was here
658568704.author: a TripAdvisor user
658568704.reviewBody: So was Humboldt, and Drake reputedly.  It\'s only a km. or so across the harbour but unless you can find a boat, it\'s a 5 km. taxi ride.  Well worth the trip however, with the modern docklands mixing it with the Colonial fortress.

656437735.name: Interesting history of Veracruz
656437735.author: a TripAdvisor user
656437735.reviewBody: In the middle of the large port is this historic fort and prison.  Its central to the Spanish conquest of Mexico and history of Veracruz.  A must see if you are in Veracruz.  We hired a local guide, Marcela Cordozo (paulina.cardozo7@gmail.com) which was a great way to see the fort and added a lot.

655102662.name: very important land mark
655102662.author: a TripAdvisor user
655102662.reviewBody: this is one of the first settlements build by the spanish in the 1500\nand  played an important role in the Mexian  history even  became  a hail  \n

652206324.name: History experience
652206324.author: a TripAdvisor user
652206324.reviewBody: I learned a lot about my heritage of Afro Mexican. The role they played in building this Fort by diving to the debts of the sea.

649029680.name: Obligatory visit when in Veracruz
649029680.author: a TripAdvisor user
649029680.reviewBody: This fortaleza has so much history and over the years many different uses for the city of Veracruz. A guide is a must to appreciate the full value of this historic gem. We took the tram from the malec\u00f3n and the same person offered her services as a guide when we got there. At the entrance there are also many people offering guided tours so it would be easy if you just came on your own in a taxi. The tram offers about 2 hours but the guided tour is about an hour and 45 minutes. My only complaint is that there is no time to visit the museum on site. Also such a shame that people feel the need to carve their names and initials into a historic priceless treasure. Very sad.

635383231.name: Grand Historical Fort
635383231.author: a TripAdvisor user
635383231.reviewBody:
The fort was a 10-15 minute taxi ride from our hotel.  We got there shortly after it opened and beat the crowd.  There were only a few people around for the first 30-45 minutes and then the tour buses started arriving.  It's always best to visit these sites as early as possible to beat the crowd and avoid some of the heat.  

We have visited at least a half dozen Spanish forts in various places and I don't think any of them have the history of San Juan de Ulua.  It's also the largest Spanish fort we've visited.  We spent several hours walking around and really enjoyed it.  I'm sure the tour guides have a lot of information about the fort, but I'm not a Spanish speaker, so that was never an option.  I read up on the history of the fort before our visit, which helped.    

The fort is surrounded by the port facilities, I'm glad the Mexican government preserved the fort, but I hope they step up their preservation efforts.  Historical sites like this are a national treasure and need to be taken care of.

631751955.name: must see
631751955.author: a TripAdvisor user
631751955.reviewBody: best way to go is to ride the piojo from Malecon, is unexpensive and punctual, Sundays there is no fee, you can hire guides, 1.5 hours enough to visit and take pictures, nice historic place

626954209.name: Great tour but...
626954209.author: a TripAdvisor user
626954209.reviewBody:
Would of been much better if there was also an English speaking guide. So much was to learn but didn’t understand a single thing. Tour bus was $50 and entrance to the fort was $60. 
Again wish there was an up charge to also have an English tour guide. 
Walls if the tort are made if coral. I understood that much!
A must see

605806392.name: Can\'t miss this while in Veracruz
605806392.author: a TripAdvisor user
605806392.reviewBody: There\'s not so much to do in Veracruz, but we do have some jewels in town, being San Juan de Ulua one of them, this is an hour, hour and a half tour, be prepared for the sun with a hat or an umbrella, the story of this historical building is very interesting as well as "Antigua" area where the Spanish conquerors first landed.

598967176.name: Beautiful visit
598967176.author: a TripAdvisor user
598967176.reviewBody: We don\u2019t usually do this visits with a tour but this one was worth it. If not you will only see stone walls and won\u2019t get the story behind. It is not expensive.  Excellent photo opportunities. Bring a bottle of water as it will be hot and sunny. And lots of sunblock!

594518157.name: Amaizing Old Port / Casttle
594518157.author: a TripAdvisor user
594518157.reviewBody:
We were expecting less in this activity; but it is a really nice place to visit.
this casttle/Port/Jail has a lot of backgroung. Strongly recommend you to pay the guide visit (40 pesos per person - 2 dollars per person).
this activity takes aroung 1.5 hrs.
we took the little bus from downtown that take you to San Juan; really worth it.

585538123.name: Unbelievable history
585538123.author: a TripAdvisor user
585538123.reviewBody:
Our second trip to Veracruz and we decided to go to San Juan de Ulua this time. 

We took the two-level very touristy looking open air bus from the malecon. It turned out to be a great choice and saved us some money. My husband is a Mexican native so he was my interpreter. 

Take hats, water, sunblock and a large umbrella with you. If you forget them, you can purchase before you enter (where the transport drops you). You NEED these items. It is HOT and HUMID and you can not purchase anything once you have paid your entrance fee! 

There was a gentleman who met our bus who ended up being a tour guide. There is a charge and he only speaks Spanish. But our guide was well worth the MXN$40 per person change. He was very informative and interesting. He also answered everyone’s questions. If you are traveling with someone who speaks Spanish, this is the way to go! 

This historic site teaches a lot about the human condition and inhumanity. It took about 250 years to build by the Spaniards using slaves and intended to be used as a site for torture and imprisonment. It remained open as a prison for  about 216 years and then was later converted to a military arsenal/fort in the early 1900s. 

The site is massive! Our guide spent about an hour with us and then we had about 45 minutes to explore on our own before meeting back at the drop off pointe and then returned to the malecon. 

The TOTAL trip cost for the 2 of us including the bus, the tour guide fee, and entrance fee was about US$16.00! (MXN$50 each for the bus, MXN$40 each for the tour guide, MXN$60 each for the entrance fee).

585107110.name: Hard to get to, but worth the effort
585107110.author: a TripAdvisor user
585107110.reviewBody: Old fort with great views and even more foto opps, not expensive and they have guided tours, very interesting. fun, but take water or you will die, water is for sale at the entrance, but nowhere inside!

583407841.name: Excellent tour
583407841.author: a TripAdvisor user
583407841.reviewBody:
Do you like and enjoy history?
This is a great tour revealing the Great History of México.
Take a hat with you or don’t complain later.
Nice place and great view of Veracruz docks.

576150510.name: First visit
576150510.author: a TripAdvisor user
576150510.reviewBody: A fantastic historic fort/prison on a scale that is tough to comprehend. Built mostly of coral on a huge scale it is impressive to say the least. It is a timecapsule of early days of historic Mexico. A must for people interested in historic Mexico and what is incredible it is now in the middle of the port of Veracruz a huge marine port that is getting larger by the day.

571554181.name: Get a tour to visit it!
571554181.author: a TripAdvisor user
571554181.reviewBody: You wont enjoy as much as if you ger a guided tour. The place is full of history ir is worthy to listen to it from someone that knows.

569810193.name: Fort well worth the visit
569810193.author: a TripAdvisor user
569810193.reviewBody: We took a taxi to get here, 90-100 pesos each way, 60 peso entry per person. Walking there would be unreasonable. An amazing complex with many stairwells, nooks, & crannies to explore. We arrived 2 hrs before closing and had just enough time. Several souvenir/snack/beverage vendors near the entrance if you need anything. It was very hot & most of the time you\'re getting pounded by rays. Bring lots of water, sunscreen, hat etc. Most information boards are Spanish, but there\'s an English section on the occasional board.

566899922.name: Tourist bus to fotress
566899922.author: a TripAdvisor user
566899922.reviewBody: Was exploring the historical area of Veracruz and came to the main tourist shopping area with all the tour buses and found a company that offered transportation and guide to this fort/fortress.  Bus ride back and forth and about 2 hours at the fort/fortress was something like 40 pesos ($2USD) and certainly not a walkable distance so said why not.  Fort/fortress was something like 70 pesos ($4USD) if even that much and the bus person gave us a tour around (in Spanish only).  We then had about another 45 minutes to ourselves before the bus ride back.  Great views of the harbor and city of Veracrua.

552721475.name: Time travel through Mexican -- and world -- history
552721475.author: a TripAdvisor user
552721475.reviewBody: Aside from providing a great vantage point for looking back at the port of Veracruz, a visit to this fort/prison allows one to REALLY feel the HORRIBLE travails of various figures in Mexican history. It also provides a good sense of how the Spaniards first approached this coast, and aimed to hold onto it in the name of their king (and for their own enrichment.) So many major events happened via this port, all through the centuries: another poignant image is that of Porfirio D\u00edaz leaving from the port for France and exile. While the Mexican Archaeology and History Institute (INAH) site in Spanish is interesting, the last time I was there they provided little onsite interpretation. I  highly recommend the blogs of John Todd, Jr. for this and other Veracruz sites, and their lively stories.

550537324.name: A Fort and Prison with stories of +500 years
550537324.author: a TripAdvisor user
550537324.reviewBody: If in Veracruz city it is a must you visit this site. Make sure to get a guided tour so you can really get the full experience and story behind the Fort and Prison. Several Mexican presidents and ex-presidents lived both in main house and prison! See the great thickness of the walls built with embedded coral. Take a walk into the prison chambers!

515722424.name: Think of people with disabilities - Guide was outstanding
515722424.author: a TripAdvisor user
515722424.reviewBody: We went on a tour bus with 45 people, 3 people needed a wheel chair and the place does not provide this type of equipment with people with disabilities.  The Tour guide was outstanding she knew history by heart and puts a lot of enthusiasm.

513143994.name: Go early to beat the heat
513143994.author: a TripAdvisor user
513143994.reviewBody: This is a great place to see and understand more Mexican history. There is a ton of stuff to learn about as well as many great backdrops for picture taking. Make sure that you bring water and a hat or umbrella, as shade is limited. There are several vendors at the entrance selling hats and water just in case you forget.

508554722.name: Interesting
508554722.author: a TripAdvisor user
508554722.reviewBody: Worth the cost. I suggest you get an English guide if one is available. When we went, a guide was not available so we had to make do. Fortunately I had read up on the fort a bit before our visit.

506534454.name: A Must See!
506534454.author: a TripAdvisor user
506534454.reviewBody: You cannot say you visited Veracruz without visiting San Juan de Ulua. A wonderful piece of history. You should be aware it closes at 4:30! We missed it one afternoon and had to return the following morning. Side note: The pictures I posted don\'t do it justice.

495737661.name: Historic and warm!
495737661.author: a TripAdvisor user
495737661.reviewBody:
You can get to this fort by taking an organized tour, a taxi or drive yourself.
There is a short walk from the dropoff/parking to the fort. Entrance is 55 pesos, free on Sundays.
If you like, you can join a guided tour, but I suggest you wander freely, there are some signs on site, or read up before you go!
The place get's hot, bring sunscreen and water and avoid midday! It's also a bit uneven and not particularily accessible if you are in need of walking aiides.
It is however full of Mexican history and well worth a trip!

494645216.name: Who doesn\'t love history!
494645216.author: a TripAdvisor user
494645216.reviewBody: This place was really cool. So much history, you could almost feel yourself transported back into the past. It honestly felt like a movie backdrop of a POTC movie.\nPlease watch your children. There are no railings or safety warnings, which although it gives you an authentic feel, can make it dangerous for wee ones..... including adults.

487667440.name: Fantastic Place To Visit
487667440.author: a TripAdvisor user
487667440.reviewBody: Veracruz is a bit off the beaten track when it comes to the usual tourist haunts in the region but it is well worth a visit. We enjoyed San Juan de Ulua immensely. it is a beautiful church with a really untouched and unspoiled vibe. Full of locals rather than tourists which was great to see. Some lovely ornate icons, statues and art inside.Well worth a visit if you are in the city.

485594064.name: Beautiful place to visit and a "must see."
485594064.author: a TripAdvisor user
485594064.reviewBody:
One you get there make sure to take carry water with you and while you can do the tour on your own, I would say to go with a tour guide and its well worth having the tour guide with you. It's a must see if your ever in Veracruz.

Museo Fuerte San Juan De Ulua
Islote de S. Juan de Ulua S/N
Col. Centro CP 91700, Veracruz, MX

485092198.name: A Must See
485092198.author: a TripAdvisor user
485092198.reviewBody:
Not going to spend much time in review.
A must see to understand Veracruz History better.
Hard to believe was cultivated from local coral reef with its prison labor, dungeons providing rarely a year of life after lock up.
Take your time and a guided tour will provide most info, early morning to visit is best during hot season.

463734656.name: Very interesting but you need a great guide
463734656.author: a TripAdvisor user
463734656.reviewBody: This very significant fortress offers a lot of history whether it is early conquest Garrison, prison or movie venue (Romancing the Stone)However it is very poorly signed with minimal info Fortunately we had a great guide able to make the place interesting( Enrique Sanchez)

459653927.name: Excellent place, it is a "must"
459653927.author: a TripAdvisor user
459653927.reviewBody: You can take a trolley car in the pier or in the aquarium plaza for around 150 pesos and all the tour takes from 2 to 3 hours. Take your cap or hat and water with you  because all the tour is in the sun.

456302342.name: Unique!
456302342.author: a TripAdvisor user
456302342.reviewBody: A very interesting place full of history. Impressive venue, very well taken care of. Being next to the sea and having the inner canals give the visitors an unique experience. Try to get a certified guide at the entrance. Its cheap and totally  worth it

454109091.name: Must see when you travel to Veracruz.
454109091.author: a TripAdvisor user
454109091.reviewBody: The castle is beautiful, a true historical landmark. I would recommend taking a tour because the castle is now surrounded by the new port of Veracruz. Visiting this place is like visiting any of the ruins in Europe. Interesting fact, the castle used to be outside the city but with Veracruz\'s growth it now sits inside the port. I found the place to be truly fascinating a place where things like operas or shows could take place if it had not been surrounded by the expansion of the port.

454004443.name: Fabulous
454004443.author: a TripAdvisor user
454004443.reviewBody: Veracuz was the main entrance for Spaniards into Mexico. The fortress was build to protect the city and was also used as a pier to shipping  merchandise into Spain as well as to receiving merchandise and people from the Old World. That\'s why this site was so important. \nIt features a museum and it has signs that described the fortress\'s history. If someone does not speak Spanish hiring a guide is highly recommended. No one shall be disappointed after visiting.

448822834.name: The Guide made all the difference - Marcela Paulina Cardozo
448822834.author: a TripAdvisor user
448822834.reviewBody: This is a historic place and has many interesting facts. In order to truly know and get the depth of this place, a guide is highly recommended. Paulina, an English tour guide gave a us a full narration  of this Castle.

447596900.name: A must in Veracruz
447596900.author: a TripAdvisor user
447596900.reviewBody: The old fortress of San Juan de Ulua harbors an interesting part of the Mexico\'s story. The spaniards started to build it on 1565. Then it was part of the walls of the city, to protect the city against pirates. You will feel a very special energy inside this place built with "piedra m\u00facara" or coral stones. It was a militar fortress, then a prison and also, government offices when Veracruz was the capital of the country for a while. You will find a very bohemian view of the old port of Veracruz. And one of the great spots to take a picture is inside, where there are a line of arcs. To get there: Take a cab in any point of the city or a bus from Downtown, they say "San Juan de Ulua".

437809974.name: Use a guide if you go there. The place has a fascinating history.
437809974.author: a TripAdvisor user
437809974.reviewBody: Very worthy of a visit and the entry fee is cheap. We hired a guide for 50 pesos (less than $3). The history of the fort is so interesting and was explained to us by the guide who spoke english.

437654712.name: Historic Fort
437654712.author: a TripAdvisor user
437654712.reviewBody: To be honest this Fort is best viewd from a distance. There is very little to actually see on the inside..

430968880.name: San Juan de Ulua
430968880.author: a TripAdvisor user
430968880.reviewBody: This place is rich with over 400 years of existence.\nFrom the early days as the East Coast gate to Nueva Espa\u00f1a (M\u00e9xico) as a fortress as well as the storage space place for all of the silver and gold and spices being sent to Spain.\nLater it became after the fall of Spain into a prison for ove 150 years to now a museum

420272079.name: Excelente, una parada obligada // Great, definitelly a must
420272079.author: a TripAdvisor user
420272079.reviewBody: Excelente actividad en la ciudad, para conocer un poco de historia y maravillarse con la arquitectura y la vista //\nExcellent activity in the city, you will learn some history and enjoy a remarkable building with nice views of the city.

420215688.name: Great place to visit
420215688.author: a TripAdvisor user
420215688.reviewBody: I strongly recommend to visit this place, a lot a history, you will spend 1 1/2 hour of you time very well.

418994841.name: Old fort built to defend the city against pirates.
418994841.author: a TripAdvisor user
418994841.reviewBody: Long walk from the parking lot to the fort. Be sure to have a guide since once you enter there are no signs to tell you what you are looking at or where to go next. Interesting place for the whole family to visit. Not wheelchair accessible.

411960308.name: Cool place but only if you speak spanish...
411960308.author: a TripAdvisor user
411960308.reviewBody: This place looks really cool and seems very interesting. I was so curious about the fort and the history about it but sadly they have no information in english... unfortunately completly unaccessible for me since I don\'t speak spanish. A tip would be to have an audio tour in english!

401335890.name: Spectacular
401335890.author: a TripAdvisor user
401335890.reviewBody: As a historian of the Caribbean visiting this fort (later turned into an infamous prison that housed equally infamous criminals as well as some respectable prisoners) was a most! The visit was worth every minute and every peso! I recommend the use of a tour guide (30 pesos per person) as they are engaging and will give you, separately, historic facts and fiction with emphasis on the historic legacy of the building(s). My mind traveled to the 17th century, too bad I could not stay there too long, the tour transport driver (not the tour guide) demanded we should be back in 1 hour and 10 minutes, which was impossible and 7 of us were left behind. A taxi back was only 70 pesos... The visit to San Juan de Ulua: PRICELESS!

401313119.name: Great all year round!
401313119.author: a TripAdvisor user
401313119.reviewBody: I\'ve been several times and it is always a great experience. It was built in the 16th Century, it was originally built as a Fortress and later on it served as a prison. Make sure you hire a tour guide, this will definitely make your visit 10 times better. If you don\'t hire a guide you\'ll still enjoy your visit and the beautiful views of Veracruz town.

394949784.name: Must for Veracruz
394949784.author: a TripAdvisor user
394949784.reviewBody: Historic monument of the New Spanish era located near the container port of Veracruz. The visit can take anything between 45mins to max 2hrs, I would say. I have seen guided tours in Spanish for a school group however not sure if English ones are available too. Maybe good to do some prior reading for a better understanding.

380172093.name: Left us stranded in the blistering heat
380172093.author: a TripAdvisor user
380172093.reviewBody: Used Turibus to visit Fort of San Juan de Ulua. We bought the RETURN TICKETS and boarded the coach, there was only us and another young couple on it, coach was nice enough and they dropped us off at the fort - told us they would return at 1.15pm and then 2.15pm. It was a blistering hot day and after we had visited the fort we waited for the bus - it never showed up and we asked the owners of the little stalls near where they dropped us off if we had missed the bus - they said it had not arrived yet - we waited for more than half-a-hour and they never showed up and the heat was unbearable - so we had to get a taxi back and as we noticed so did the other couple that was on the bus with us. Obviously didn\'t think it was worth returning just for 4 people. Terrible - avoild at all cost - also discovered later the other bus service was 10 pesos cheaper just to rub salt into the wound.

375245265.name: Lots of history
375245265.author: a TripAdvisor user
375245265.reviewBody: Very interesting place.  A must for anyone visiting Veracruz.  Not much signage so get a guide or read up on it before.

371048241.name: It\'s a must
371048241.author: a TripAdvisor user
371048241.reviewBody: When you are in Veracruz a visit to its "Fuerte de San Juan de Ulua" is really a must. It is recomendable to hire a guide who will tell you about the important historical moments which this place has seen: From the role it played during the Mexican War of Independence as the last stronghold of the Spaniards to the Mexican Revolution and the Invasion of the North Americans. Veracruz and this Fort have made history for hundreds of years.And it will give you the creeps when you are standing in the dark and humid prison cells remembering all the people who suffered and died here.

361797887.name: Interesting historical site for tourists
361797887.author: a TripAdvisor user
361797887.reviewBody: The fortress is in good shape, you can see that government is interested in keeping national historical sites in good condition. On the entrance you will need to pay the entrance fee of 55 pesos. And it is highly advisable to get the guide with you - there are not too much of the information boards with descriptions. Also there is no audio guides available there. But, anyhow, the place is cool!

358997136.name: Easy to get to
358997136.author: a TripAdvisor user
358997136.reviewBody:
Easy to get to but lots of sunlight so make sure you wear sunscreen.

This old Fort and jail houses history and great views of the port.  Easy to see modern and old veracruz and some history.

There are very few story tellers but you can tag along each group and try to listen in.

351156336.name: Historic Landmark of Veracruz
351156336.author: a TripAdvisor user
351156336.reviewBody: This fort played an important role in the establishment of Veracruz as a critical place for the Spanish colonization of Mexico and in the success of the galleon trade between the Spanish colonies in Asia, the New World and Spain. Our guide was very knowledgeable and one of the few who can do the tour in English. A must see if you are in the Veracruz area.

345994973.name: Really cool!
345994973.author: a TripAdvisor user
345994973.reviewBody: Beautiful fort, amazing views. We were lucky enough to have a great guide who told us many stories of the building and people who resided there. If you go without a guide, you probably won\'t get as much out of it, but there is a book for sale at one of the little kiosks in front that gives a good history. Make sure to go up to the top of the battlements!!

345870487.name: Great place to visit in Veracruz
345870487.author: a TripAdvisor user
345870487.reviewBody: An interesting stop, it was a good place to wander around and learn about the history of the port.  There were plenty of signs and features to support a self-guided tour.

345043480.name: One of my favorite stops
345043480.author: a TripAdvisor user
345043480.reviewBody: Bring a good camera, lots of batteries or charge, as you will easily shoot hundreds of photos here.  I\'ve never seen anything like this.  Our guide (Guillermo at Arenas) was soooo knowledgeable and that just added to the experience.  Costs next to nothing to get in, but go early as they close early.  And don\'t forget the camera!

344874756.name: Well-restored but needs explanation.
344874756.author: a TripAdvisor user
344874756.reviewBody: This fort needs a guide to tell its unique history. We brought ours or would have missed the many stories the old walls told. (I didn\'t see guides at the entrance.). Barring that, some signage would help.\n\nInteresting juxtaposition of the old with the modern - large cranes lifting sea containers.

344834468.name: more a ruin than a fortress
344834468.author: a TripAdvisor user
344834468.reviewBody: It is in the midde of the port. It was important for the defence of the city and the harbour but now is deserted

344601795.name: Worth a visit
344601795.author: a TripAdvisor user
344601795.reviewBody: This is an important part of the history of Veracruz and it is worth a visit. It is best to book a tour with a guide.

334139111.name: Hire a guide.. It is well worth it.
334139111.author: a TripAdvisor user
334139111.reviewBody: If you want to enjoy the place, hire a tour guide, other than that you will only see walls, and that\'s it. Guides are affordable at the entrance of the place, there\'s no power inside the place, so try to attend early in the morning, and don\'t buy any food or drinks before entering the Fort, they won\'t allow them inside. Wait till you exit the place to buy water and souvenirs.

329443174.name: Wedding
329443174.author: a TripAdvisor user
329443174.reviewBody: This fort was very creepy but cool and the history behind it was very interesting. The way prisoners lived there was horrific and it felt weird like the air was heavy. Overall an excellent experience if u like that type of stuff.

309130098.name: Nice place to spend no more than 1 hr.
309130098.author: a TripAdvisor user
309130098.reviewBody: Great historical place, full of content and right outside the city center. Really a place to visit if you are in Veracruz.

308778779.name: Amazing!
308778779.author: a TripAdvisor user
308778779.reviewBody: I loved this place!  Def. worth a trip and make sure you get a tour guide.  The fort is entirely made of live brain coral, its pretty neat!  You also learn about the people jailed in this fort and some interesting facts on how inmates were treated.

305502985.name: a historic place to let your imagination fly
305502985.author: a TripAdvisor user
305502985.reviewBody: If you like history you would find a lot of it in this place,the former Spanish forificacion , is located in the Chalchicueyecan Island (prehispanic name) , now known as San Juan de Ulua. The resort and island are off the coast of the Gulf of Mexico in the port city of Veracruz in the Mexican state of the same name , The construction of the fortress was planned by the Spaniards under Hern\u00e1n Cort\u00e9s 22 April 1519 in the context of the discovery of America and pirate attacks and privateers of the time against Spain . you have to see this place.

296757547.name: Very interesting
296757547.author: a TripAdvisor user
296757547.reviewBody: This tour was very informative and interesting. We were taken to every part of the fort and given the full history of it. You would do yourself a favor to take this tour. It was fun.

294971286.name: A lot of History
294971286.author: a TripAdvisor user
294971286.reviewBody: It\u00b4s a very old place, foundated almost 500 years ago. It\u00b4s very interesting and beautiful. The only problem it\u00b4s that if you are not with a guide you won\u00b4t understand it because it doesn\u00b4t have enough signs to describe it.

293686435.name: Very interesting!!!
293686435.author: a TripAdvisor user
293686435.reviewBody: Super interesting historical site, very close to our hotel (Emporio).   Easy to get a bilingual guide if needed.

279415807.name: A WINDOW TO HISTORY
279415807.author: a TripAdvisor user
279415807.reviewBody: Once built to defend the port against pirates and enemies, it was later used as one of the most infamous prisions for political disidents.\nDefinetly worth a guided visit, or buy a booklet to learn about this construction and its uses.\nSomewhat retired, if you don\'t have your own car, but with a taxi it takes perhaps 10 to 15 minutes from the center.

279298717.name: Formidable example of colonial military architecture
279298717.author: a TripAdvisor user
279298717.reviewBody: Built to ward off pirates and foreign invasions, the fortress was enlarged throughout the colonial period until it became the massive complex you see today. After the Mexican Independence, the fort served as a prison noted for its harsh conditions and for the famous people incarcerated there, among them Benito Ju\u00e1rez. The beautiful crenellated walls, projecting straight up some 11m (36 ft.) from the water\'s edge, and bastions at each corner, are just espectacular. Inside is a large courtyard, with wide ramps along the inside walls, storehouses, barracks, and old prison cells. Before you enter the fortaleza, make sure to have plenty of water, specially in the very hot months of summer. Restrooms are well kept. Hours are Tuesday-Sunday, 9:00-16:30 Hrs. Price is about 50 pesos, but teachers, students and kids under 13 are free. Guided tours are available with appointment through the museum: (229) 938-5151.

274862578.name: A little boring
274862578.author: a TripAdvisor user
274862578.reviewBody: I liked the people, food, waiters, drinks relax, hotel. I did not like poluted port water water. I did like all the many vendors coming to cafe tables.

268411971.name: Worth the Visit
268411971.author: a TripAdvisor user
268411971.reviewBody: If you want to see some great Veracruz history then this is worth your time.  Admittance is free on Sundays, so it can be very worth you money too.  There are both group and private tours, in both English and Spanish.  Or you can walk the fort on your own.  It\'s rather large and, all things considered, one of the better preserved historical sites in the city.  \nTake caution if you go with kids, there is a significant lack of guard rails and an abundance of places to fall.  Also, for anyone using a walker or wheelchair, this will be a difficult place to explore and, in many areas, impossible.\nIf you have any interest in historical sight-seeing, are age appropriate, and can walk up and down steep steps and ramps, then you will enjoy San Juan de Ulua.

267259952.name: Jail Love - San Juan de Ulua
267259952.author: a TripAdvisor user
267259952.reviewBody: I think this is the only Mexican prison I really fell in love with! Chucho "El Roto" story is an amazing example of the daily live of people from this city during XVII-XVIII centuries. This fort is very similar to those i have seen in Philippines and Macau.

266396084.name: Very impressive
266396084.author: a TripAdvisor user
266396084.reviewBody: This is by far my very favorite place in Veracruz. Have you ever seen a fort made out of coral? This is it! If you enjoy ancient historical buildings this is a most. I enjoy every single room.

266263853.name: Excellent
266263853.author: a TripAdvisor user
266263853.reviewBody: Visited the Fort of San Juan de Ulua when I was very young and I have great memories, can\'t wait to return and have my kids experience it.

264818324.name: Beautiful Fort middle in the port of Veracruz
264818324.author: a TripAdvisor user
264818324.reviewBody: Indeed the industrial activities around the fort is not nice. However this is really worth the visit.\nWe saw that some renovation are on going. I hope that it will continue.\nIn any case worth the visit

263658622.name: Ruins no better than ok.  We booked a ride from a double decker bus for 150 pesos each.  Our guide spoke only Spanish
263658622.author: a TripAdvisor user
263658622.reviewBody: We booked a ride for 150 pesos each on an open topped bus. Our guide spoke not a word of English and there were no interpretive signs. In and out of these dungeons for one hot and sticky hour.  After all was said and done, we really had very little clue.  Had to get home to find out about it.  Thought it would be about Cortez..Our bad.  Wouldn\'t recommend it.

261954255.name: Mexican history
261954255.author: a TripAdvisor user
261954255.reviewBody: Well worth seeing. The history behind the fort is amazing and you learn so much. How it was built and how Veracruz began to exist.

260124833.name: Shamrock Languages visita el Fuerte de San Juan de Ulua
260124833.author: a TripAdvisor user
260124833.reviewBody: This was a really nice experience, we had a tour guide who was nice and gave us all the interesting information about this place\u00b4s history, it was great!

246492565.name: Worth the trip.
246492565.author: a TripAdvisor user
246492565.reviewBody: Nothing is labeled! So do a tour, or read up beforehand. Considering that nothing is labeled, the admission is a bit steep. BUT once you know what\'s what, it\'s worth the trip to see the slimy prison cells, storage cells, presidential palace, cannons, views, and 100 year anniversary exhibit of tossing out the U.S. Gotta cab it from downtown if you don\'t book the tour, there\'s no other way.

239665897.name: Historic Site that you should see once ...
239665897.author: a TripAdvisor user
239665897.reviewBody: Get into this fort and experience history first hand ... its thick walls have contained prisioners of relevance in Mexico\'s colonial times ... a must visit also when in the city of Jarochos ...

233948681.name: Spanish Fort and Prision
233948681.author: a TripAdvisor user
233948681.reviewBody: Veracruz history starts here.  The beginning of the Spanish conquest of Mexico its vividly presented in a walking tour.

227552006.name: Trully remarkable building!
227552006.author: a TripAdvisor user
227552006.reviewBody: Being on this kind of building really makes you think really hard on how difficult was back then, and at the same time, how resourceful those builders were!, This is a must visit while being down in Veracruz, you won\'t regret it!

226669233.name: Steeped in history and great place to explore
226669233.author: a TripAdvisor user
226669233.reviewBody: If you\'ve ever built a fort in your living room using pillows, sheets, blankets, chairs and the like, you will REALLY appreciate the architecture.
