This grand facility is a testament to the days of things being built to last.  I had a great time poking around and taking pictures. Photos don\'t really do the place justice in terms of scale of the place.  It also has a great view of the city and port.  The entry fee is waived on Sundays.

216301970.name: Lost of history in these walls
216301970.author: a TripAdvisor user
216301970.reviewBody: I did enjoy visiting San Juan de Ulua. It is worth to pay a guide. Patricia was really nice and charged 20 pesos per person. Plan to stay about 1 hr 30 min average and bring sunscreen!!!  The entrance is 48 pesos per person. Students, senior citizens, and teachers don\u00b4t pay but a current ID is needed. You can buy water outside the Fort. No food or drinks inside. Something that shocked me was to see the coral in the walls after almost 500 years!!. It is amazing how well preserved it is.

207270753.name: History and culture at your hand !!
207270753.author: a TripAdvisor user
207270753.reviewBody: It\'s a great visit into the emblematic history of the first port of Mexico at the Spanish conquest ... it\'s quite interesting to visit and you can find guided tours at a good price ... don\'t forget to bring water and sunscreen ;-)  Sundays are free admision for everyone !!!

200410459.name: A lot bigger than expected.
200410459.author: a TripAdvisor user
200410459.reviewBody: We expected a fairly small fort, but we spent at least two hours, and did no get to see all of it, there is also a site museum, it is on the second floor of one of the newer buildings, make sure to take a guided tour at the entrance. well worth the visit and its easy to get to from downtown.

198410716.name: Very interesting
198410716.author: a TripAdvisor user
198410716.reviewBody: Nothing not to like. Very old and historical site. They even let me in for free because I was over 60.

193685237.name: great history lesson - be sure to use a guide
193685237.author: a TripAdvisor user
193685237.reviewBody: we had a great guide (in Spanish) for 20 pesos.  it really added to the experience as there isn\'t much documentation in Spanish or English throughout the fort.  Be sure to take water, a snack, and sunscreen!  We took a taxi (60 pesos each way) from the malecon across from La Gran Peruccia caf\u00e9.

192855086.name: Wonderful place to visit
192855086.author: a TripAdvisor user
192855086.reviewBody: Make sure you have your walking shoes on because there is just one beautiful historical site after another.  Recommend as a must see if in Veracruz.

182739654.name: WELL-PRESERVED PIECE OF VERACRUZ HISTORY
182739654.author: a TripAdvisor user
182739654.reviewBody: A well-preserved piece of Veracruz history found just outside of centro historic. You will have to get there by taxi, bus, or city tour bus.  The cost varies but average is less than $5 transportation and less than $5 entrance fee per person.  Guided tours are available but I found they only have Spanish tours.  However after you pay your entrance fee you are free  to walk around and learn via the arts of reading photography and translation at home. It is just a must see because Veracruz is a significant part of Spanish colonization.

180179032.name: Fort of San Juan de Ulua-Veracruz
180179032.author: a TripAdvisor user
180179032.reviewBody: Museum has a great collection of items from Aztec Culture.  Also most of the traditions of their time explained in English.  Just opens up your eyes to what they did so many years ago.

175466830.name: Lots of History
175466830.author: a TripAdvisor user
175466830.reviewBody: If you are someone who appreciates history and architecture, then you must visit this place, the whole fort was built of coral! The history behind it is incredible, you can still taste and feel everything that has occured here! Take your time and wonder around by yourselves!!!!

174177256.name: A fort that saw a lot of action.
174177256.author: a TripAdvisor user
174177256.reviewBody: The fort was build in the 1600\'s and has seen all kinds of action.  It was originally built on a sand bar and completely surrounded by water. It not only acted as a protective fort but also as the storage area for all shipments of everything from sugar cane to gold and silver back to Spain.  It has experienced a number of attcks by pirates and also served as a prison during the Spanish Inquisition and even through the Mexican Revolution.  Interestingly its 3 to 6 meter thick walls are built from coral.

173548838.name: Not much to see
173548838.author: a TripAdvisor user
173548838.reviewBody: I enjoyed the history of the fort but there are no sign explaining what you are looking at.  Since we just saw the forts in San Juan PR, we kinda knew what the different rooms were for.

169677777.name: Pretty neat area
169677777.author: a TripAdvisor user
169677777.reviewBody: The fort was being rehabed when we went so some ares were still off limits. \n  Pretty amazing structure, built a lot from coral. \n  I am looking forward to another visit now that the rehab is done.

169208095.name: very big
169208095.author: a TripAdvisor user
169208095.reviewBody: lots of history. Very hot there. but cool inside the jail cells. the surrounding\'s is boring lots of commercial transportation.

163863598.name: Old fort old times
163863598.author: a TripAdvisor user
163863598.reviewBody: This was well worth while seeing and the ferry across was an extra bonus. There are numerous warrens to navigate and there is one alley where it seems they used it for taget practice or an execution area.

158279370.name: Be sure to hire a guide
158279370.author: a TripAdvisor user
158279370.reviewBody: This is an interesting fort turned prision. The structure consists of several different buildings separated by moats. There are no placards to explain the function of the buildings, so it\'s best to hire a guide to get the full story of this landmark.

155178495.name: A historic site you don\'t want to miss
155178495.author: a TripAdvisor user
155178495.reviewBody:
I visited the fort my first time in Veracruz.  It was a great experience and my family loved it.  

This is a great place for pictures! Bring your cameras!

You should be prepared for prolonged time in the sun. Don't forget the sun block and hats!

154771712.name: Great Historic Site, Bring a Guide
154771712.author: a TripAdvisor user
154771712.reviewBody: Having studied a great deal of Mexican history, I found this place to be overwhelming.  I couldn\'t believe I was standing in a place where it all more or less started.  Also, having grown up in the States, buildings dating as far back as this are few and far between, so it was amazing to see.  What I didn\'t like was that there weren\'t really any signs stating what anything was.  I\'d recommend either reading up on it thoroughly before you go or seeing about hiring a guide so you can get a fulfilling experience.  Also, bring plenty of water and wear a hat if you\'re going in the summer because it gets HOT!

154516828.name: Amazing
154516828.author: a TripAdvisor user
154516828.reviewBody: This place is a must see,  Castle of San Juan de Ul\u00faa, is a large complex of fortresses, prisons and one former palace on an island overlooking the seaport of Veracruz, Mexico. I recommend you go visit with a tour group, they have some buses and bring people to the Fort where you can pick up a guide, in English or Spanish. Otherwise, be prepared to pay 30 dollars, about 320 pesos, for a private tour. They do offer the option of waiting to see if there are any other families that will split the cost for you. There is a lot to see, you\'ll need at least 2 hours to view it all. Check out the purgatory jail, and don\'t be afraid to walk in the cells. It\'s an excellent history lesson for all.

151577155.name: A great place for photos.
151577155.author: a TripAdvisor user
151577155.reviewBody: A fort is a fort is a fort...But not this one.  It had many interesting nooks and crannies.  Well worth the visit.

151534588.name: And it will get better
151534588.author: a TripAdvisor user
151534588.reviewBody: this fortress is a piece of world history, it is in its finishing stages of renovation, if you go on Sunday admission is free. There are some guides that will take random groups. you can walk into virtually any cell, and little hole there is. It is a good experience.

151253398.name: REAL OLD FORT
151253398.author: a TripAdvisor user
151253398.reviewBody: This is a real old fort with the old cannons that they used to fight off the invaders coming by ship. Lots of history here.

148752513.name: Reconstructed Fort
148752513.author: a TripAdvisor user
148752513.reviewBody:
You can see the old buildings, yet some parts are reconstructed for you to picture it as it was centuries ago.

I think it's important to take the historical tour inside the fort so you can listen to history events, the phases the fort went thru, and also the different uses of the fort. There are a few interesting stories about the prisioners of the Fort of Ulua.

If you like taking pictures, there are a lot of beautiful corners and angels. The sun and heat strikes the fort almost all day long, so take a hat and sunscreen.

147567123.name: Cool views of Veracruz ... but little a little bit in shambles ...
147567123.author: a TripAdvisor user
147567123.reviewBody: The fort has a nice view of the city and its historical significance is immense both during the Spanish colonial period and the Mexican-American War ... however it would be nice if they kept it renovated a bit more and if you didn\'t have to pay a guide to learn details ..

146107174.name: Well built fort
146107174.author: a TripAdvisor user
146107174.reviewBody: What a great example of building with concrete.  With walls more than 3 feet thick, this place will easily be standing another 500 years.  Very impressive structure, interesting to see and experience the dark, dank rooms that at one time were prison cells.  Even one of Mexico\'s former presidental heroes was imprisoned here.  A FREE attraction, also!

142342303.name: The most impressive fort in Mexico
142342303.author: a TripAdvisor user
142342303.reviewBody: The fort is humongous and really impressive, you get to see where Benito Juarez was kept, some vaults are slowly becoming caves, with tiny stalactites and stalagmites growing, it\'s located right next to the port and you can see gigantic cranes and containers - also very, very impressive (and a bit sad to know the historical fort is completely surrounded by industrial areas!)

135003850.name: Spooky and cool place to see!!!
135003850.author: a TripAdvisor user
135003850.reviewBody: They say this place is haunted at night and I can see why.!!! It contains some old warehouses that once contained Spanish gold, prisons where pirates and other cut throats were kept,and a fort that was used to deter pirate attacks like those of Captain Morgan. You can easily get a guide who will explain everthing, just dont do on Mondays-it will be a wasted trip since they are closed.

134228245.name: Amazing Piece of Architecture & History
134228245.author: a TripAdvisor user
134228245.reviewBody: The Fort of San Juan de Ulua is an incredible piece of history - It was an island fortress used by Cortes to bring the Spanish over into Central America. I spent the better part of the afternoon in awe of the structure and its layout. With its moats and drawbridges and cave-like chambers it brought me to another time and place. I felt as if I were back in the 1500\'s at times. My favorite site in Veracruz.

133894258.name: dark and interesting
133894258.author: a TripAdvisor user
133894258.reviewBody: Had a really nice afternoon walking around the ruined fort! We were lucky enough to tag along with an organised tour ...unfortunately this was in Spanish so my girlfriend had to translate for me, definitely something different to do when you are fed up of the beach.

127418705.name: interesting sidetrip
127418705.author: a TripAdvisor user
127418705.reviewBody: A disturbing yet interesting look into life in colonial Mexico . The jail cells evoked haunting images .\n\nIt is very hot here , so protect yourself from the sun

126782872.name: Fort of San Juan de Ulua
126782872.author: a TripAdvisor user
126782872.reviewBody: We had a group of about relatives on this trip to the fort. We decided to get a guide. All of the relative spoke Spanish except for me. The guide translated in English just for me. He was great!

125603060.name: Historic Fort
125603060.author: a TripAdvisor user
125603060.reviewBody: You can feel the history in each of the old wall. It tells you the stories of pirates, prisoners and the life of those times.

125156812.name: Better seen from the malecon
125156812.author: a TripAdvisor user
125156812.reviewBody: The fort is currently being restored so it may imporve somewhat, Right now there is not a whole lot to make the trip out there worthwhile.

124547228.name: great history
124547228.author: a TripAdvisor user
124547228.reviewBody: have to pay to go inside, not alot to see\nalso was unable to take photos inside

123977754.name: An island of peace
123977754.author: a TripAdvisor user
123977754.reviewBody: It\'s a good place to avoid the crowd.\nYou will have a good time visiting this old fort-prison. \nBut I agree, for families with children, it can be a stressfull time as there is little to protect someone from falling from...everywhere.

123763430.name: Being surrounded
123763430.author: a TripAdvisor user
123763430.reviewBody: There is a lot of history behind these walls. Today it is devourded by the surronding port. From what used to be an island to land fill in order to creat the port of Veracruz. Great to visit even yet.

120741761.name: Interesting
120741761.author: a TripAdvisor user
120741761.reviewBody: Lots of walking, which was hard for us. We brought my mother in law who can\'t really walk much. They lent us a wheelchair at the entrance, which was good but nonetheless, half the time we couldn\'t use it because it just wasn\'t possible. Was an interesting tour, informative.

37322784.name: an experience you can\u00b4t miss, but don\u00b4t take your kids!
37322784.author: a TripAdvisor user
37322784.reviewBody: San Juan de Ullua used to be a jail back in the time of President Venustiano Carranza, it was considered the worse Jail of all Mexico, and after being in Alcatraz, I think this one was 10,000 times worse. It is an experience that you can\u00b4t miss if you are visiting Veracruz, but the whole place is not very safe for young children. As a teacher I always think about the risks and this place in located right next to the ocean and there are many hidden places where kids can get easily lost. The admission fee is very low and it offers discounts to teachers, elders ( over 60\u00b4s) and teachers. It\u00b4s a very interesting and mysterious place.

1537057.name: surprisingly good
1537057.author: a TripAdvisor user
1537057.reviewBody: A gem in the middle of cargo containers. Very interesting history and architecture. Our guide was very good, but strict about keeping us close by. Not good walking(difficult) for some seniors(especially). It will be a real tourist attraction in about 5-10 years, when the canal is finished. It is drained now for archeological digging, and repair of the base of the fort. No concern about visitor safety like in the states, ie no railings, if you fall in, oh well(as it should be). Had to pay 20 pesos to use the facility, which was marginal-no surprise. \nGreat photo ops. Short trip from the port.

1133387.name: great place
1133387.author: a TripAdvisor user
1133387.reviewBody: It was very neat a must see if visiting veracruz ! Did you know that romancing the stone was filmed there.

829583.name: A petite fort with a big historic role
829583.author: a TripAdvisor user
829583.reviewBody: I visited the fort for research material for my historical novel, the war with Mexico (1846-1848).  The fort was attacked on 4 occasions: by the Americans in 1847 and 1914 (which was news to me), by the French in 1864 (while we were busy with the Civil War) and a fourth time which I do not recall.  Pirates liked the port of Vera Cruz as well.  I think of the fort as being petite when I compare it to the Spanish fort in St. Augustine.  It is also petite compared to a huge drydock vessel moored close buy, cargo carriers stacked with containers 4 units high, and the surrounding city.  I went looking for holes in the wall caused by the American and French bombardments, but found none!  American Express donated $150,000 (a plaque so attests) to repair the fort.  The entrance is guarded by armed soldiers.  The site is now shared with the Mexican navy and is refereed to as arsenal #3.  A large number of patrol boats and civilian sailboats occupy the harbor.  Fort Ulua, though built of coral reef, was apparently plastered over and painted a canary yellow and red ocre.  Fully restored and painted it would shine like a jewel in the Caribbean.  The Fort is connected by a causeway now being covered with sand from the surf that actually form dunes!  There is a small museo on site.  I wanted a history of the fort in print, but none were offered for sale.\n

348318.name: intersted place.
348318.author: a TripAdvisor user
348318.reviewBody: well. the forth of san juan de ulua in the port of veracuz, mexico,iit is an intersted place to visit ,(today part of it is under repairs)i was there in earely december 20001, it got a lot of history, it got more than 400 hundreth years old. it was a forth against buccaners and pirates, then was a customs wherehouse ,santa inquisition torture jail of the catolic church.military wherehouse and a prision (chucho el roto was there,benito juarez,lopez de santa ana, etc)if you travel to veracruz ,dont forget to go to san juan de ulua, the entrance fee is 30.00 pesos. (3.20 us dls)and is better to get a guide tour is better because they explain everything, is very intersted, so thats my experience in san juan de ulua forth in veracruz, mexico.  pedro garza..  email   pedro@garza.to    bye. and god bless you..\n

582719239.name: Very good fish and ambiance
582719239.author: a TripAdvisor user
582719239.reviewBody: This is still a pueblito even though it is only a short way off the main hwy on the outskirts of town near the water where they are building new hotels. I had the Robalo (sea bass) a la plancha (grilled) and it was really good. The other choice is Huachinango (red snapper). The people are really friendly. Paid a 3 piece band (they were good) 70 pesos to play la vida no valle nada. Kind of out of the ordinary for Veracruz but everyone knows it. Took the boat (lancha) ride in the lagoon. Glad I went there.

571145483.name: Let me eat in peace!
571145483.author: a TripAdvisor user
571145483.reviewBody: This was a horrible experience! The food was okay. We ate at Restaurante Mandinga on the main land side. We couldn\u2019t get a bite of food in our mouths because we were getting bothered every minute by some new vendor trying to sell something or someone trying to play music. The shrimp tasted like chlorine.

539195349.name: A nice day out
539195349.author: a TripAdvisor user
539195349.reviewBody: We had a boat ride around the lagoon which was pretty but sadly developement is encroaching so it won\u00b4t be for much longer. There are lots of eateries and we enjoyed some spectacular oysters, shrimps and other fresh seafood.

602419079.name: Beautiful and inspiring ElTajin
602419079.author: a TripAdvisor user
602419079.reviewBody:
The archeological site El Tajin is easily reached from either Posa Rica as Papantla by public transportation, or by the  so called  collectivos and taxis.  A bus costs M$15 one way, a collectivo M$20. Last bus back to Papantla is around 7:30 pm and takes 15 minutes. Catch bus adjacent to the Pemex gas station.
It is a 20 minute walk from the bus stop to the entrance. Vendors sell water, snacks and souvenirs. 
Entrance fee is N$70.
The site is wonderful with many benches to sit down and look at the beautiful  buildings, carvings and to just ponder. You will need at least two hours to walk the area. It is hot, so take your time. 
The small museum has a model of the site and some interesting relics and carvings
In the middle of the site, a handful vendors sell snacks and drinks. 
Many small stalls bordering the parking lot sell food and drinks.
Unfortunately the only bathroom at the entrance was out of water and therefore out of order.
One could use a less clean bathroom at one of the stalls.
Good for a splendid half day visit.

491294591.name: Wonderful Lifetime Experience
491294591.author: a TripAdvisor user
491294591.reviewBody: It is a Must!!   A wonderful life experience that is so amazing to see and experience how lucky to feel we could go and relive this amazing culture.

454112480.name: Spectacular Ruins
454112480.author: a TripAdvisor user
454112480.reviewBody: Must see. one of the most popular and most well preserved ruins in the world. The place is fantastic in many ways. For history, for its architecture even for the peace there is once inside the park. Must see.

421178840.name: Nice ruins to visit El Tajin
421178840.author: a TripAdvisor user
421178840.reviewBody: It\'s nice to walk along all the historic monuments of the Totonacs.  The villagers come and sell vanilla and other drinks and food along the walk.  There is a museum at the entrance.

409039125.name: Beautiful
409039125.author: a TripAdvisor user
409039125.reviewBody: Amazing place. Too hot. Don\'t forget to wear hats and confy clothes and tennis shoes. Bottle of water is needed.

403445017.name: Espectacular
403445017.author: a TripAdvisor user
403445017.reviewBody:
This is one of the best archeological  sites in Mexico,
Has a lot of buildings shown.
Very intersecting explanation provided by guides.
Well maintained and several buildings are in the process to be uncovered

382855372.name: EL TAJIN, INCREDIBLE ARCHEOLOGICAL AREA
382855372.author: a TripAdvisor user
382855372.reviewBody:
I have had the chance to visit the most of the archeological areas in Mexico, and I have to say that El Tajin has been one of the most impressive ones. We hired a tour guide who explained us pretty well the distribution, the architecture and the traditions that used to be present during the growth of the Totonaca culture. So impressive. 
The landscape is magnificent and the maintenance given to the area is so good. 
Definitely a place you gotta visit if you are on holidays by the area. 
Before leaving the facilities, there's a good restaurant with good prices and good food.

366480135.name: A charming, magical town
366480135.author: a TripAdvisor user
366480135.reviewBody:
Papantla is at the centre of Mexico's vanilla production, and also home to some of the most beautiful sights in the state of Veracruz.  The well-known voladores de Papantla have their origins here, and you can regularly see them perform in front of the central church in town.  There is also a large statue commemorating the voladores, to which you can easily walk from the centro.

Papantla also has good cafes, a beautiful central park, and bustling marketplaces.  The experience of eating on a balcony overhanging the town's active park as the voladores perform nearby was magical and unforgettable.  

Moreover, the town is nearby to the historical site at El Tajin.  

Papantla has been designated a Pueblo Magico due to its wondrous historical, cultural, and gastronomical heritage.  It is a must-visit for travellers to the state of Veracruz, or who seek to encounter the 'real' Mexican experience.

365821181.name: Beautiful place!
365821181.author: a TripAdvisor user
365821181.reviewBody: Beautiful, interesting, well kept! You can see more than 40 buildings and appreciate the ancient culture\'s life in a land that, although it is a dense jungle, it is a most fertile place for all kinds of crops.

298558233.name: Not very interesting
298558233.author: a TripAdvisor user
298558233.reviewBody: Well, I\'m talking about the town (the Tajin at 5 minutes is amazing). At this little town is almost imposible to get a parking place, I thing is only visited for the Vainilla stores among the downtown. People is veryyyyyyyyyy friendly, but you only can visit the church, the monument of the "voladores" and eat in the small restaurants around the park. From this point you can visit 3 diferent beaches at 1 hour, but be prepared the road is in very bad conditions, I mean veryyyy bad conditions. In one day you can do this tour: Tajin at the morning,  papantla (1 hour) and and beach. You must not take the detour to Poza Rica, at 5 minutes will find the next exit to Papantla.

288155101.name: Magic reunite past and present
288155101.author: a TripAdvisor user
288155101.reviewBody: love to visit Papantla, eat a homemade vanilla ice cream cone, mingo with the locals and buy vanilla.  papantla is known as the capital of vanilla city. but what I love of this city is their citizen, many still dress and speak the totonaca language and dress in authentic tipic dresses and you can travel to el tajin ruins and learn the history of this beautiful community. Outside the Ruins is a marketplace full of colorful ethnic crafts and food.

268198639.name: Great short stop.
268198639.author: a TripAdvisor user
268198639.reviewBody: Visited Papantla as a lunch stop while traveling between Mexico City and Emerald Coast for a beach weekend. A great stop for a few hours, but not much beyond that. Popular overnight before visiting El Tajin, we but didn\'t stay overnight. Had a nice lunch over looking the Zocalo, watched the Voladores in the church courtyard, and did a little shopping for vanilla (prices are a little higher than at El Tajin and even Mexico City Mercardo San Juan, but more authentic.) The concrete murals and a few statutes add a little charm to the city. Don\'t stay too long or you\'ll get bored, but worth a short stop.

267974401.name: A Not Magical Town
267974401.author: a TripAdvisor user
267974401.reviewBody: We have visited 60 out of the 80 magical towns in Mexico. Papantla is not pretty. We are not sure how this town got that status.\nIt is quite ugly with nothing of value to visit. I guess because it is close to el Tajin and the Indigenous Eco Center it gets to claim that. This is an old run down Spanish town where at one time vanilla was a huge industry. Perhaps with incoming tourism the town will have a reawakening. \nI wouldn\'t recommend this as a destination location at this time.

266264398.name: Loved it
266264398.author: a TripAdvisor user
266264398.reviewBody: I love el Tajin, I am born very close to Papantla and I recall visiting way before it was touristy.  It has changed throughout these years but change is good.  I will definitely be back so my boys can experience it the way I did when I was younger.

261961054.name: Very nice city
261961054.author: a TripAdvisor user
261961054.reviewBody: Lots to see, fresh vegetable and fruit stands all over. Make sure you stop at the Vanilla plantation just before the city. Very nice store with what I am told the best vanilla ever. Have not tried it yet. They also sell a vanilla liquor called Xanath. The vanilla is made by the Gaya family.

259778260.name: Not worth the trip
259778260.author: a TripAdvisor user
259778260.reviewBody: I was excited about seeing this "pueblo magico" (not sure who gave it that name), but was very disappointed. First, on the way from the bus station to the zocalo (about a 3-4 block walk), someone walked up to us to offer to sell us cocaine (seriously? I mean we were a conspicuous-looking group of 3 foreigners, one with dreadlocks, but oh my!). Once we got to the zocalo we walked around it, looking for a place to have breakfast. EVERYONE stared at us the entire time; not just a quick glance and looking down, not staring and smiling and waving, but just constant, expressionless, staring. We had a very greasy breakfast at one of the restaurants around the square, and got a taxi to El Tajin. I\'ve heard there\'s an artisan\'s market but didn\'t see it, and I don\'t think my travel companions would have wanted to spend more time there anyway.

238186642.name: Nice little mexican town
238186642.author: a TripAdvisor user
238186642.reviewBody: O.k. there is not much to do beside visting Tajin, which is one of the best archeologal places I havd seen in Mexico and hanging arround the zocalo, but that place has a lot of character, everybody is there at night with all the little stalls for food and drink.

233776585.name: 3 days with  the family
233776585.author: a TripAdvisor user
233776585.reviewBody: great little town many local people moving arround lovely center park to just sit an relax also lots of shops & rest.an a local market with many things done by the people there

199456008.name: Interesting, but boring
199456008.author: a TripAdvisor user
199456008.reviewBody: Tajin is the most interesting archeological site I\'ve visited: The pyramids are awesome and the plastered walls (stucco) are a unique sight. Unfortunately, the rest of the city is boring: Nightlife is limited to a few spots of loud music, and daylife revolves around the park. Nothing much to see.

174044750.name: Unique experience, close to El tajin
174044750.author: a TripAdvisor user
174044750.reviewBody: Papantla is seldom visited by foreign tourists. It is a small town with a rich history (home of vanilla) and psychic energy. There are a couple of hotels on the square to stay at, while you visit the El Tajin archeological site. The atmosphere is different than anywhere else in Mexico, in a good way.

148922422.name: Fun time.
148922422.author: a TripAdvisor user
148922422.reviewBody: We visited the nearby archelogical site. Very interesting. Had the best tacos from a cart in town from a cart vendor. Interesting drive through town.

147237646.name: Interesting site
147237646.author: a TripAdvisor user
147237646.reviewBody: I have been here a few times and each time there have been changes, but of course. As time goes by tourists are being limited to where they may clime or enter and for good reason.

144033095.name: Smallish place with VANILLA
144033095.author: a TripAdvisor user
144033095.reviewBody: stayed a night in Papantla to be able to visit El Tajin and get some vanilla pods. It definitely has less charm than other places and we were surprised, that there was no gastronomy around the vanilla beans, had hoped to try something vanilla based...

124587259.name: Classic beauty of a Mexican town
124587259.author: a TripAdvisor user
124587259.reviewBody: My wife and I spent a weekend in Papantla and plan to return.  The Tajin Hotel is in the next block from the downtown park and Catholic Church.  It was a great bargain at $35 (US) per night.  The Teodoro Cano museum, Voldadores, Statue of the Voldadores are also within walking distance of the Hotel Tajin.  The bus to El Tajin ruins picks up passengers on the same street of one of the hotel restaurants.  The 20 minute bus ride costs about $1 (US) and runs every half hour from 9am to 6pm.  The sit of the El Tajin ruins is the most popular tourist site in Veracruz with more than 650,000 visitors annually.  A huge variety of typical Mexican food is also within walking distance, of the Hotel Tajin near the typical Mexican downtown park.  You can find all kinds of Mexican food eating places, from fancy restaurants to taco stands and street vendors.  It is all delicious!

123601733.name: Visited Papantla after touring El Tajin
123601733.author: a TripAdvisor user
123601733.reviewBody: Papantla is a nice quiet town - the main attraction being it\'s close vicinity to El Tajin, an absolutely fascinating site of pyramids which are strikingly unique from any other pyramid sites in Mexico.  Papantla is a nice place to stop and have lunch or dinner following your visit.  They have a very nice centro, and it is a good example of a traditional Mexican town.

22565944.name: authentic mexico
22565944.author: a TripAdvisor user
22565944.reviewBody: very friendly people, a place i would return to, to soak up mexico the way it has been for a log time. also to take a bus ride to cuetzalin through the country side from papantla. you could do a circle tour, enjoy a beautiful site where mexican people claim to have seen the image of their virgin, also near cuetzalin is an ancient city of the totonaco people with no tourists around. nothing at all like the west coast of mexico./Users/ianrobinson/Pictures/iPhoto Library/Modified/2007/mexico2_2/073_73.JPG

14686717.name: Nice city near "El Tajin"
14686717.author: a TripAdvisor user
14686717.reviewBody: Small city in the state of  Veracruz, Mexico. Near the ruins of "Tajin" (6Km).\nCharming central place and catedral.

636198085.name: Worth a Visit
636198085.author: a TripAdvisor user
636198085.reviewBody: We enjoyed the exhibits and learned a few things about Mexican history.  We were surprised at how nice the museum is layed out.

613935641.name: Great museum!
613935641.author: a TripAdvisor user
613935641.reviewBody: Great naval museum, with a lot of rooms (all air conditioned) full with historic things of the Veracruz harbor and the Mexican Navy, several scale models of ships, planes, helicopters (one real), guns, uniforms, and all the naval parafernalia and traditions within a historic building. A must if you visit the city.

601127375.name: 1st rate naval/maritime museum
601127375.author: a TripAdvisor user
601127375.reviewBody: An excellent stop in Veracruz. The museum shows off the history of Mexico\'s navy along with the history of the Port of Veracruz and its role in Mexican history, One room also shows the role navies play in maintaining the health of the world\'s oceans. Exhibits  feature paintings, weapons, uniforms and several very clever computer aided effects, of special interest to children.\nMost of the exhibits are only described in Spanish. The museum does not offer wifi. It does have good air conditioning for hot days.\nThere is a small cafe with a gift shop.

599409157.name: Interesting place tovisit
599409157.author: a TripAdvisor user
599409157.reviewBody:
It was a rainy day so I had to do something different in Veracruz. I decided to visit the museum downtown Veracruz. There you can see  or get to know some aspects of the mexican history through the history of navy in Mexico. There you can see haw native Mexicans used to sail and their batles in the sea and coast before the Spaniards came.
There you can also see some ship types and also you can try your skill with a ship simulator. 
There is a psecial hal dedicated to the U.S. invasion in 1914, where many brave Mexicans died.
In my opinion it is a great place to visit with kids, it is design to have them involved and entertained.

598965202.name: Very nice
598965202.author: a TripAdvisor user
598965202.reviewBody: Small but interesting and very interactive for the kids. PLUS it has A/C so it was a blessing. It is a good museum to learn about Mexico\u2019s naval history

585106683.name: Loved this place
585106683.author: a TripAdvisor user
585106683.reviewBody: one of the best Mexican museums that I have been to, airconditioned and 3 blocks away from the docks and the plaza

582720952.name: very good
582720952.author: a TripAdvisor user
582720952.reviewBody: A definite must when in Veracruz. A lot of interesting history. Nice building. The guard outside was agradable and helped me with directions.

559907497.name: It\'s not all military stuff!
559907497.author: a TripAdvisor user
559907497.reviewBody: One of Mexico\'s great national museums and not to be missed.  Quite a lot of bilingual signs, but the more you know about Mexican history the more you will get from your visit.

554875054.name: Very Interesting and Educational Place
554875054.author: a TripAdvisor user
554875054.reviewBody:
GREAT place to visit.  Very informative regarding the history of the Mexican Naval Forces including some of the history of the State of Veracruz.

Also, had the opportunity to meet and talk to the museum Director and he was very helpful and friendly.  He invited me back for a personal and more detailed tour but I did not have the time for another visit.  

Thanks for everything and I extend my sincere appreciation to all the staff !!!

551363781.name: Museo Naval Mexico
551363781.author: a TripAdvisor user
551363781.reviewBody:
This museum is great! 
Full of interesting information about the history of Veracruz and it’s navy.
A lot of interactive areas, it has many antiques and plenty of other interesting exhibits.
I fully recommend taking the time to visit this place, it was a fun and informative experience.

548694896.name: Among my favorite museums
548694896.author: a TripAdvisor user
548694896.reviewBody: This is among my favorite museums, anywhere in the world. Offers a great overview of Veracruz\' history and connection with the rest of the world, and brings Mexican history alive in unexpected ways. Along with San Juan de Ulua and the Baluarte de Santiago, the Museo Naval helps provide some real understanding of how lively history can be!

539141671.name: Great place to visit!
539141671.author: a TripAdvisor user
539141671.reviewBody: It is one of the places in Veracruz that you have to visit. All exhibitions are good planned, interesting, have good and clear explanations. This museum has air conditioning so it will be really pleasant to spend time there.

497007578.name: Great history lesson
497007578.author: a TripAdvisor user
497007578.reviewBody: The museum is air conditioned so it\'s a pleasant experience. They have different rooms for different time periods. You can join a tour but we went at our own pace and really took our time. The entrance was about $2 but worth much more. The tour takes about 30-45 minutes depending on your interest level. If you like history, you\'ll love this place.

496335175.name: An interesting, informative, and comfortable way to sight see for a couple of hours.
496335175.author: a TripAdvisor user
496335175.reviewBody: The displays and building are well maintained. The interior of the building is comfortably air-conditioned. You\'ll get more from the experience if you can read Spanish, but you will still enjoy the museum if you do not.

493702144.name: Well worth a visit
493702144.author: a TripAdvisor user
493702144.reviewBody: At first we went to the Faro (lighthouse) just off the malecon, but was told it was not the Naval Museum, but just offices, although I believe it used to be the museum. The sailors on guard at the Faro were very nice and helpful and told us it was a couple of blocks down the road. We found it easily and were not disappointed. It is very modern, with many interactive exhibits. We were in there for nearly 2 hours and there is much to see and many rooms to visit. The museum has a wide variety of exhibits that have been thoughtfully laid out. It was also inexpensive to enter, about 40 or 45 pesos. There is a small restaurant with pleasant and helpful staff and was surprisingly cheap to buy refreshments. Also there is a small shop with many nice and interesting things you could buy if you so wished. We bought a mug. To sum up, I would recommend the museum if you visit Veracruz and is suitable for adults and children alike.

481331033.name: Great Local History!
481331033.author: a TripAdvisor user
481331033.reviewBody: The museum highlights the American invasion of 1914 when President Wilson had sent  4 American battleships and scores of Marine and Army military to invade and capture Veracuz.  Highlights include timelines and specific strategic battles which were carried out by both the Mexican Military, Militia and the public at large.\nThe Museum also highlights current Naval strengths, training and capabilities.

476527979.name: Fun to visit
476527979.author: a TripAdvisor user
476527979.reviewBody: The curators have made a real effort to portray the naval museum as part of an ocean going experience.  The lighting and exhibits are "watery" and well-presented.  There is no English, but Google translator and I managed to understand most of the exhibits.  English is not really necessary, since the museum is mostly visual.

459656786.name: Pretty interesting museum
459656786.author: a TripAdvisor user
459656786.reviewBody: This museum exceed my expectations. There are some naval vehicles in the esplanade where you can enter free but don\'t miss all the experience.

456970445.name: Good to be seen.
456970445.author: a TripAdvisor user
456970445.reviewBody: Good to be seen. It was really interesting to me all exhibition. If you stay here you should visit it.

440023766.name: Perfect!
440023766.author: a TripAdvisor user
440023766.reviewBody: We really enjoyed this new and well maintained museum, it is located near by zocalo of city. The price was 45 mx and we spend there about 2 hours. It is really nice. Definitely recommending.

432499121.name: Our favorite site in the city of Veracruz
432499121.author: a TripAdvisor user
432499121.reviewBody: It\'s clear, Mexico is proud of it\'s navy.  They spared little expense on this museum  It was closed for renovation when we arrived in Veracruz, but opened before we left.  It was freshly painted and pristine.  The exhibits were extremely well done.  The museum follows a counter clockwise circle around the perimeter of the building.  Don\'t be fooled by the \'emergency exit only\' signs.  The doors will automatically open when you approach them.  It took us over an hour to see the whole thing.  The helicopter, plane, and boats in the entrance courtyard were interesting and you can climb on or in most of them.

420215009.name: great museum
420215009.author: a TripAdvisor user
420215009.reviewBody: excellent place to learn about naval academy and history, very clean, cheap and very entertainment..

418995642.name: Modern museum,well designed with lots to see and learn.
418995642.author: a TripAdvisor user
418995642.reviewBody: Really enjoyed this museum. It has excellent exhibits and has some interesting things for children. Some of the cadets were there and were very helpful and gave us more information about the museum.

403727341.name: Good place to while away an hour or so
403727341.author: a TripAdvisor user
403727341.reviewBody: The museum is well maintained and has some nice exhibits.  But given the long naval history of Mexico and Veracruz in particular, there is not a lot to see.  Plan to spnd an hour or so if you want to take in every exhibit fully, a half hour otherwise.

386786980.name: First world museum
386786980.author: a TripAdvisor user
386786980.reviewBody: It was the first time a attended this museum and I was impressed by the order, cleanness and all the items they have in order to preserve the history of the mexican navy since colonial to present time. It is interactive museum with a lot of multimedia halls. It is located close to Malecon and is easy to park or to get it.\nThe route is well signposted and easy to follow.

371049419.name: One of the best museums
371049419.author: a TripAdvisor user
371049419.reviewBody: This new museum is really outstanding. It shows the naval history of the country from precolonial times to the present. Many interactive games help you to enter a world long ago - if you try to build a ship yourself, navigate on the ocean or accompany Cort\u00e9s on his siege of Tenochtitl\u00e1n. You enter the world of the oceans with video projections of the marine world all around you and experience all the sea battles of Mexican history.

365689136.name: great, modern museum. Air Conditioned!!
365689136.author: a TripAdvisor user
365689136.reviewBody: A real modern museum, at 45 pesos per adult. Easy to spend 2 or 3 hours checking out the history in the comfort of AC.  I would not hesitate to take friends and family there when visiting Veracruz.

357171163.name: Well run museum
357171163.author: a TripAdvisor user
357171163.reviewBody: Well run professional museum with active duty seamen as staff. Presented the history of the Mexican navy up to current times. Some detailed models of old sailing ships with sectional views. Large computer simulation where one can take a ship out of harbor. Some unique gifts in the gift shop. I bought some shot glasses for friends that collect.

345298592.name: Great looking architecture
345298592.author: a TripAdvisor user
345298592.reviewBody: Was strolling around checking out the sights when i came across the naval museum. looked great from outside. and saw few naval items in the surrounding yards but unfortunately was closed when i got there, was on Sunday eve, bummer but bet it would be nice to see being i am a sailor myself.

344836205.name: nice maritime museum
344836205.author: a TripAdvisor user
344836205.reviewBody: The naval museum was renewed and is now realy modern. You get a good overview of the naval historry of Veracruz. You can even steer a ship on a 3D simulator

340203612.name: First class!
340203612.author: a TripAdvisor user
340203612.reviewBody: This is a new museum. It presents the navy today, the local history and Mexican history related to the seas. The displays are beautiful and the explanations are excellent although only in Spanish.

336523775.name: Outstanding Naval History Museum
336523775.author: a TripAdvisor user
336523775.reviewBody: If the sea and naval history interests you this is one of the most outstanding interactive museums anywhere. When Hernan Cortes arrived in the 16th century the native Totonac Indians had a small fleet of boats. Did you know that the US attempted to invade Mexico during WWI? Throughout the tour you will travel over water, under water and in the air above the water as does the Mexican navy.

336227166.name: Extraordinary experience!!
336227166.author: a TripAdvisor user
336227166.reviewBody: One of the best museums, fun, well explained, clean, great museography, nice with kinds and also teens. Restrooms clean, there is an helicopter for kids below 11

320997578.name: AWESOME !
320997578.author: a TripAdvisor user
320997578.reviewBody: Awesome museum, a lot of history and very well explained. The cost is very affordable, around 1 USD. You can spend a whole morning learning about the history of Veracruz, its forts, navy and a lot more. It is a time well spent, besides you can get inside turrets and manipulate them. there is also a a boat simulator and a helicopter section.

319869494.name: Absolutely Brilliant
319869494.author: a TripAdvisor user
319869494.reviewBody: Well worth the few dollars for admittance fee! This is a beautiful museum that is extremely well maintained. The displays are well done. This is a highly recommended thing to do for about 3 hours when visiting Veracruz.

263254115.name: Interactive, fun
263254115.author: a TripAdvisor user
263254115.reviewBody: This is so newly updated that your guidebook may not mention how spectacular it is.  You can view yourself in the rigging of a ship, captain an aircraft carrier, sit in a helicopter (if you are 12 or under). Totally worth the small admission price.

258687882.name: Mexico vs USA
258687882.author: a TripAdvisor user
258687882.reviewBody: Most interesting to know how a hand full of teen agers defended their city and school against the American invasion of 1914

250711634.name: Excellent and well worth the visit
250711634.author: a TripAdvisor user
250711634.reviewBody: At 30 pesos the entrance, this is a great deal, the building is beautiful , the quality of the exhibits are fantastic , the navy staff are very helpful and superbly dressed. Definitely a must to visit

248001192.name: Fascinating
248001192.author: a TripAdvisor user
248001192.reviewBody:
Really enjoyed the musuem. 
There is nothing in English so I imgine you might have to get a guide if you don't speak or read spanish but the exhibits are very informative with some exquisite models.
Really recommend it and the section of the East west trade route through veracruz to Acapulco for the Philippines was facsinating.
Plus it was 30pesos to get in (it may be free on Sunday's but I'm not sure) 
The musuem although in a beautiful old building is very modern inside and I noticed ramps for wheelchairs.

238450690.name: Very educational and pleasant
238450690.author: a TripAdvisor user
238450690.reviewBody: This museum is run by the Mexican Navy. Everything is absolutely spotless and there is a lot to see, starting in pre-hispanic times up through today. Clearly a lot of thought and pride went into this museum. Covers Mexican history which admittedly can be quite confusing. \n\nAll the indoor exhibits are cool and dark and can be a delightful relief from the sweltering sun. Some knowledge of Spanish would be helpful, making a richer experience, although not entirely necessary. Some of the modern exhibits are interactive, such as a ship simulator and a room for kids to play. There is also a cafe on the premises.

233949477.name: New Museum of Naval History in Veracruz
233949477.author: a TripAdvisor user
233949477.reviewBody: Nicely done presentation of Mexican naval history.  Some excellent multimedia rooms.  Well thought out and informative, I guess\n\nOne major complaint.   All of the explainaions of the exhibits are in Spanish.  No English.   When we toured the Luoce and the Orsay in Paris last month, 75% of the exhibits or more were into and sometime four languages.  Draw your own conclusion

233776134.name: 3 days with  the family
233776134.author: a TripAdvisor user
233776134.reviewBody: very informative many things to see they give a good tour its in the center of the town easy walk to very nice outing with the family also  no cost \n

233208691.name: I was amazed of all the things that I learned in a couple of hours!
233208691.author: a TripAdvisor user
233208691.reviewBody:
Great place, every Mexican citizen must go over there and spend some time learning about Veracruz's history.
The place is impeccable, it was extremely clean and organized.

All the rooms have a dedicated topic regarding a time frame on Mexico's History.

I learned a lot of things about Veracruz's people. 

I highly recommend to visit this place with your family. I'm sure that you will have a great time.

231895490.name: A Fascinating walk through history
231895490.author: a TripAdvisor user
231895490.reviewBody: The Naval Museum was recently renovated and it looks impeccable. It has all kinds of items in their exhibit, audio, video, interactive as well as historical items. After the tour is completed you can pay a visit to their souvenir shop and of course, the coffee shop. The coffee shop has been nicely decorated and they have several things on their menu from sandwiches to dessert. Their coffee is excellent and the service as well.

229204816.name: New an improved
229204816.author: a TripAdvisor user
229204816.reviewBody: The remodeled museum now charges an entrance fee.  However, the fee is well worth the intersting, well presented exhibits.

227552624.name: Historical Naval Refence for Mexico
227552624.author: a TripAdvisor user
227552624.reviewBody: This is one of the places that fills my chest with pride of being Mexican!, How amazing is this museum?, Really amazing!, You will find stories and memorabilia that will take you back in time to really appreciate the efforts, discipline and engineering that a naval fleet needs to work/function.

221238145.name: Made me want to join the Mexican navy
221238145.author: a TripAdvisor user
221238145.reviewBody: I read that this was the best museum in Veracruz, so when I found myself right outside I decided to visit. It\'s cheap to get in ($2 or $3 US, I think) and really nicely done: high tech displays in an historic building, plenty to see from the time of the Spanish conquest to the present day, including news reports in English from when the US attacked Veracruz in 1914, which I didn\'t know about before. The whole place is obviously an exercise in propaganda, but you wouldn\'t expect any country to be unpatriotic about its military. I enjoyed it, even though almost everything is in Spanish. You don\'t need to know the language to understand displays of weapons and scale models.

198292994.name: Closed
198292994.author: a TripAdvisor user
198292994.reviewBody: We went there in early March 2014. Still closed and boarded up with no info. As observed by another reviewer, the photo on the Trip Advisor page is not of the museum.

190867152.name: Closed until ?????
190867152.author: a TripAdvisor user
190867152.reviewBody: This was closed - 10th Jan 14 - (boarded up around the perimeter) with no signs saying why or when it would re-open. No officials in sight to ask either

185788776.name: Good, photo not correct
185788776.author: a TripAdvisor user
185788776.reviewBody: The Museo Hist\u00f3rico Naval is good but not great. The colection is poor for a port with so much history and importance trough the centuries.\nBut it\'s worth for a 1 or 1 1/2 hour visit, specially if you go with kids.\nCaution: the photograph doesn\'t belong to the museum (belongs to the Faro Venustiano Carranza).

167554805.name: A little town with a big place in Mexico\'s history
167554805.author: a TripAdvisor user
167554805.reviewBody: The museum only takes an hour to visit, at most, unless you read every word of every display. I really enjoyed it.

164897931.name: A nice museum
164897931.author: a TripAdvisor user
164897931.reviewBody: This has more history and fewer ship models than most naval museums. The galleries are chronological and they tell the history of Veracruz, which has been so much a part of the overall history of Mexico. It\'s a beautiful building with interesting maps and historical relics.

163863781.name: Mexican Armada
163863781.author: a TripAdvisor user
163863781.reviewBody: This was a good visit and I enjoyed it, maybe because I am an ex-mariner. The exhibitions are very good and well documented. It was a pity that their modern exhibits romm was closed when I was there, but well done full marks

150413571.name: A must see
150413571.author: a TripAdvisor user
150413571.reviewBody: Altought a visit to Navy Museum might not seem like something interesting, the port is so important for the history of the city of Veracruz that you will find lot of interesting information and data that will enrich your understanding of this beautiful city.

148753207.name: Where history lives
148753207.author: a TripAdvisor user
148753207.reviewBody: The museum has a lot of replicas, photocopies, artifacts, and mostly accurate information about the Spaniards\' conquest and how they entered the mexican territory. It\'s interesting to see it and spend time.

147238360.name: This is the photo of the Lighthouse
147238360.author: a TripAdvisor user
147238360.reviewBody: The cannons and 50 cal machine guns are out on the lawn. The Navel Military complex is behind the Lighthouse.

146245182.name: Veracruz is the Navy\'s Town
146245182.author: a TripAdvisor user
146245182.reviewBody: Mexico is Museos, and the Museo Historical Naval is a great attraction in this historical Mexican city. The Museo will take you back through Mexico\'s naval history where all of the Naval world powers launched their intrusions into Mexico. The Museo is located within one of the Navy\'s buildings, so you need to know the operating hours of the museum. The Museo is not overwhelming, but tastefully done and will provide a couple of hours that will help you understand Mexico\'s unique history. Enjoy!

139690939.name: Of great interest and well looked after by the Navy..
139690939.author: a TripAdvisor user
139690939.reviewBody: Nowhere can you go, to get better or more accurate information on the Spanish Naval invasion of the Americas and the subsequent repulsions and fierce naval AND land battles that ensued in this area and further up to Tampico. Plus, you can see it all here where the action was centred.\nIf you want to look after something in this neck of the woods, then give it to the Navy to look after;  they will do a wonderful job.   It must be something about the care and attention they give to their ships and buildings; but whatever it is ; it works.!  The building itself was extensively damaged in the action and now has been returned to its "military" look.  The guides and attendants are all current Naval personnel, and you will be treated with precise and polite attentiveness and if you show an interest in all things nautical, then of course this will help to make the whole visit very pleasant.  You can get lots of smiles  around here.

125603421.name: Interesting
125603421.author: a TripAdvisor user
125603421.reviewBody: The naval history of the port is shown here, interesting for those they like the subject.

124774545.name: A pleasant two hour walk through history
124774545.author: a TripAdvisor user
124774545.reviewBody: While this is not the world\'s greated Naval Museum, it makes for a pleasant history lesson of Mexico\'s watery adventures. Many exhibits are photocopies, replicas or mock-ups. A beautiful building, friendly cadets and a few benches to rest. During our visit mid-February, a few rooms were closed and under renovation, including the armament exhibit. Free of charge!

89530349.name: All you might want to learn about the sea and naval history of Veracruz
89530349.author: a TripAdvisor user
89530349.reviewBody: We found the museum interesting. It was filled with most everything that had anything to do with the history of Mexico as long as there was a connection to the sea. It was run by the Mexican navy and we had to sign in to get inside and sign again when we left. It was a free museum but they wanted to send a young guide with us. She spoke no English and spoke Spanish too rapidly for us to follow so we talked her into not ushering us around. Of course, there seemed to be an emphasis on naval warfare and also former President Carranza. The signs were all in Spanish but we could understand enough to figure out what was happening. It was cooler inside than outside too so if you find the weather too hot and sticky and needed a bit of relief then go there. It\'s worth a full half hour and more if you can understand the Spanish descriptions well.

631756309.name: nice snorkeling
631756309.author: a TripAdvisor user
631756309.reviewBody: warm sea, you should buy personal ticket by 150 pesos, some will ask between 150 to 250 but is the same, they all depart from same place and do same tour to sacrifices island and cancuncito, they charge extra if you need snorkeling equipment so better to take yours, nice coral and hedgehogs

600002018.name: Nice swim
600002018.author: a TripAdvisor user
600002018.reviewBody: You need to go nearby the aquarium of Veracruz to get an offer to travel to this reef. Prices may vary, since there is no a toll to hire the trip. They take you to Isla Sacrificis where you can see the the lighthouse and if your lucky a bunch of colorful fish beneath the boat you are traveling. It takes about five minutes to get to the reef where you can stay and swim and watch diferent color fish. Some guides can take swimming some other father places where you see erizos and other stuff. It is not very deep and you have to be careful of not stepping on  coral or erizos. Guides may hire you snorkel equipment for about 100 pesos, so you have to be ready for that, beacuse they don\'t tell you about this service beforehand. \nYou can not take any sea shell or coral from the place. Food and time is limited there, so you have to take the most of this experience in the middle of the sea.

586170068.name: Amazingly beautiful
586170068.author: a TripAdvisor user
586170068.reviewBody:
There are lots of options to get here. We decided on the more cost effective way since both my husband and our friend are Mexican nationals. 

Warning: wear lots of sunblock, have sun glasses, and bring snacks, etc. But most of all wear water shoes!

We went down to the boats near the Aquarium and we negotiated a price to go out to the island. 

It is a protected island so you can not actually go on it. We went around and saw schools of fish in various colors. The guide was very interactive, but all in Spanish. 

We then went out to a point where you get out of the boat and can swim in about waist-high water. This is where the water shoes are most important. I had ones but my husband and our friend did not. I swam far from the boats and was able to see lots more coral and fish varieties because I had foot protection. The water is no more than about 5 feet maximum depth so, even with snorkel gear, you will want to break and stand up. You can not do that without protective shoes. And flip flops “chanklas” will not do it!

It was a magnificent trip. If we had more time in Veracruz, I would have gone again.

481672015.name: WOW!  VERY cool trip!
481672015.author: a TripAdvisor user
481672015.reviewBody: I had a great time going out in a little boat to see the reef.   We found coral and creatures below ( very shallow water) but you can\'t keep any of it!  Still fun and worth experiencing

660011991.name: probably the best aquarium in Mexico
660011991.author: a TripAdvisor user
660011991.reviewBody: Perfectly organized, air conditioned , no busy lines, free for senior citizens, with mexican i.d., entrance fee only 80 pesos which is a steal, considering whay you pay for the same in Canada and USA. You can arrive right at the entrance by bus which is only 9 Pesos and come one after another, either direction.Dowtown or Boca del Rio.

650306865.name: Nice aquarium
650306865.author: a TripAdvisor user
650306865.reviewBody: Nice spot to visit. Be prepared for a 20-30 min line on busy days. Spend an hour or two walking around, see the dolphin exhibit and the penguin exhibit towards the end. Gift shop is part way through. \n

631753158.name: nice sharks pool
631753158.author: a TripAdvisor user
631753158.reviewBody: nice place, great sharks pool, many species to watch, dolphins show before exit, penguins exhibition with additional charge

627073434.name: Not to be missed
627073434.author: a TripAdvisor user
627073434.reviewBody: Wonderful number of exhibits from free flying guacamaya and tucans, mangrove and deep ocean fish, manatees sharks and reef species. The dolfin show was amazing highlighting the grace, agility and strength of them. We enjoyed the interaction of trainers and the dolfins. The keepers speak English around the main reef tank and encourage questions. Most signage and interpretation is given in Spanish and English. Take care with toddlers or distracted friends - around the first exhibits it seems easy to fall into the water.

616589392.name: Awesome exhibits. Much to see. Has Food Court
616589392.author: a TripAdvisor user
616589392.reviewBody: I was skeptical with It being in a mall but it was well worth it. They have penguins, sharks, manatees, lionfish, jellyfish, turtles, parrots, garrs, dolphins and so much more. There is even a fifteen minute free dolphin show that featured four dolphins. There is also a food court inside along with multiple gift shops so its perfect if you are looking for a gift.

608214933.name: What a Great Venue
608214933.author: a TripAdvisor user
608214933.reviewBody: The aviary right when you walk into the aquarium has some awesome characters hanging about! The sharks, local tropical fish and eels are something else! As are the very playful Bottle Nose Dolphins, which you can swim with. My favorite were the Giant Sea Turtles! Great spot to visit!

601129798.name: Under the sea at the mall
601129798.author: a TripAdvisor user
601129798.reviewBody: Despite being housed in a shopping mall, this is a very high quality aquarium. There are exhibits of sharks, rays, jelly fish, Latin American species, dolphins and penguins. The place is very popular with families and has a gift shop. Most of the exhibits have full or partial English explanations. You can pay to help feed sharks or have a picture with a dolphin. The mall has a food court and also houses a wax museum.

599408391.name: Great place to visit
599408391.author: a TripAdvisor user
599408391.reviewBody:
The aquarium of Veracruz is aood place to knoaw about different marine species. You can sse some fish that live in Mexico's coasts. Also you can see some birds like guacamayas, you can even can get a picture with a red one. 
The path i tne aquarium starts with a set of guacamayas and turtles. Then you can see some  fish pools wth pejelagartos that are native from south Mexico.
There is an oceanic fish pool where you can see rays, barracudas, turtles and some sharks.
There are some pools where you can observe some jellyfish. They are very nice and iti is interesting to see this kind of animal.
There is also a pool with dolphins where you can have a presentation about them and you can pay to get the chance to swim with them.  
The last part in the aquarium is the place where you see some nive pinguins which belong to the Humbolt type.
Geenrally speaking you can have a great tiem there and if you have kids, they will love it!

594520324.name: Charming Attractions
594520324.author: a TripAdvisor user
594520324.reviewBody: This is a wonderful place to relax and escape the summer heat of Veracruz. It is a well stocked collection of fish and sea mammals, including manatee and porpoises. Nice flow of foot traffic and an entertaining  porpoise show. For a geezer like me the cost is about $4.00USD-- a real bargain!

593893889.name: Great experience
593893889.author: a TripAdvisor user
593893889.reviewBody: Always a fun thing to do when in town.  The  Penguins are adorable.  The tanks are amazing.   Other things to also do in center it is located in.

588658664.name: Fun day at the aquarium
588658664.author: a TripAdvisor user
588658664.reviewBody: My daughter, her boyfriend, his sister and I decided to go to the aquarium for a little while. Very cool place with lots to see and do. Great way to spend some time.

587052553.name: Interesting and a lot of exhibits
587052553.author: a TripAdvisor user
587052553.reviewBody: Spend a couple of hours there. Tours can be guided or on your own. Surprising how many different exhibits they had. We caught the 11:00 am dolphin show which was fun. The jellyfish, manatee, and penguins were our favorites. Worth a visit.

582847232.name: Worth a visit!
582847232.author: a TripAdvisor user
582847232.reviewBody:
Veracruz has the largest and most important aquarium in Latin-American. While there are the cringe-worthy attractions such as shark-feeding and dolphin shows, there is also a selection 30 species of fish that many of the visitors to the aquarium would not have the chance to see anywhere else such the tambaquias, arowanas, pacus, red-tailed catfish, jackknife fish, African cichlids and many others in a tank holding an impressive 562,117 cubic liters of water.

While animal rights activists may protest, the facility promotes the preservation of the marine ecosystems and the care of the environment. In addition, the aquarium is government-owned and provides an important economy to the city of Veracruz.
Definitely worth a visit!

582720663.name: nice aquarium
582720663.author: a TripAdvisor user
582720663.reviewBody: Definitely worth checking out. Some very cool ways to check out the fish. Nice dolphin show. I always love the medusas (jellyfish). There were penguins there!

580667594.name: The experience with penguins is marvellous
580667594.author: a TripAdvisor user
580667594.reviewBody: Touching the penguins and having them so close is extraordinary. The veterinarians do a great job training them and looking after them. We even had some pictures with them. We learned a lot about penguins. Highly recommendable!!!!! A unique experience!!!

571145775.name: The aquarium is mediocre!
571145775.author: a TripAdvisor user
571145775.reviewBody: Not worth the money :( the dolphins were fun to watch for a minute. There were way too many people. It felt like cattle being pushed through the halls.\n

566898576.name: An hour or so at the aquarium....
566898576.author: a TripAdvisor user
566898576.reviewBody: Headed to the largest aquarium in Central/South America so expected a bit more.  In a mall with other tourist sights (kinda odd) but you could buy a combo ticket for a number of them, but I just got the aquarium ticket for 130 pesos ($7USD).  Was nice to walk around and see the variety of fish, sharks, penguins and of course dolphins.  But need to be honest and say that seeing those three dolphins in a small swimming pool/tank and performing for the people and then forced to then take pictures with them really was an eye opener.

560456683.name: Awesome
560456683.author: a TripAdvisor user
560456683.reviewBody: definitely this is great place to visit, excellent service, I recommend the dolphin show, it was great

559181622.name: A MUST see when in Veracruz
559181622.author: a TripAdvisor user
559181622.reviewBody:
Many years ago I have been to aquariums both in Florida and San Diego but I cannot remember having seen something like this in my life!

There is another aquarium in Mexico City but, so I was told, the one in MC is smaller ...
I will check this out in a few days when returning to MC.
Entrance fee for an adult is 130 Peso.

555681198.name: Not to miss!
555681198.author: a TripAdvisor user
555681198.reviewBody: It is one of the most important aquariums in the world! For all ages you will find sharks, otters, penguins, dolphins, turtles and even parrots.

550506283.name: Aquarium of Veracruz
550506283.author: a TripAdvisor user
550506283.reviewBody:
Overall it was a good experience. The place is clean and lol taken care of and it has enough animals to keep it interesting. 
But some of the bigger creatures (dolphins and belugas) had very small enclosures, which was quite alarming and disappointing.
Smaller children seemed to enjoy it more.

527137251.name: Nice aquarium
527137251.author: a TripAdvisor user
527137251.reviewBody: Went with family a 5 and 9 year old they both enjoyed it very much. You walk under the shark tank and they have a lot of different kinds of fish. They have some jelly fish, dolphins and penguins.

516113528.name: Nice for a day out with the family
516113528.author: a TripAdvisor user
516113528.reviewBody:
Nice attraction for the kids.
Lots of fish and sea life to see, even dolphin show daily.
During our visit there was no dolphin show, but our kids have seen so many dolphins in their life so they were not really dissapointed.
Interesting and educational for youngsters.

516069257.name: Awesome aquarium
516069257.author: a TripAdvisor user
516069257.reviewBody: We visited Sept.2017 for our family vacation and its a big aquarium and the dolphin show was great.We had visited various aquariums but this one ots just amazing specially the people are very friendly.

515592278.name: Life time experience
515592278.author: a TripAdvisor user
515592278.reviewBody: Definity... Swim with dolphins where awesome. Had spend 30-35 minutes in the pool with the kindest species on the planet.. was a lifetime experience....

508554427.name: Enjoyable
508554427.author: a TripAdvisor user
508554427.reviewBody: Spent a couple of hours walking through the aquarium and enjoyed it very much. It would be a great family place to visit. Reasonable prices.

504329597.name: Good but no other world experience
504329597.author: a TripAdvisor user
504329597.reviewBody:
Rates are no so fare, $ 180 MXN each.

Some attractions are under construction and you are not aware until you get inside, have guided access but not availabld all the time, because of that, you have to read any sign to get yourself instructed about wildlife and their nature.

No restaurant of cafe inside, so eat something before you get inside the aquarium.

Monday's are closed, the rest of the week are open from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm, sorry have no holiday data about available schedule.

Nice, but that's it, no other world thing.

Regards 🙏🏼

502570032.name: Cute!
502570032.author: a TripAdvisor user
502570032.reviewBody: A fun cute little aquarium with lots to see! Very cool exhibits with halls that you can see the animals swim above and beside you. Great variety! Lots of food options and shops in the building. They also offer packages with a museum and ripley\'s wax museum.\nNote: use restroom before you come, bathrooms cost 10 pesos. Sure it\'s not a lot, but it\'s kind of annoying. That\'s not to do with the aquarium itself though, so I still give 5 stars!

501697991.name: Greatest Place
501697991.author: a TripAdvisor user
501697991.reviewBody: This place is for all the family, great diversity of species of the sea life, the principal fishbowl is huge, we check the tunel fishbowl and you can see all the sides of the sharks and fishes inside, is a great experience.

500267007.name: a must if you are near
500267007.author: a TripAdvisor user
500267007.reviewBody: one of the most interesting things you can do as a tourist in this area is wonder around the aquarium, it is a very entertaining experiene for young ones, and even older ones. they have a nice dolphin mini show and also got penguins.

495482576.name: Great dolphin experience
495482576.author: a TripAdvisor user
495482576.reviewBody: We had an amazing experience with dolphins at the aquarium , much cheaper than the prices I last checked in Xcaret, it will be an unforgettable experience for my kids, the trainers were quite knowledgable and helpful, the swim with the dolphins was about 35min and together with pictures (2 kids, 1adult, digital pictures) I paid about mx$5000 (US$280), not cheap but I\'ve shopped around and this is the best deal found. I highly recommend it. Veracruz has been an overall great experience for my family .

494641240.name: Pleasantly surprised
494641240.author: a TripAdvisor user
494641240.reviewBody: I was happy with this aquarium. Lots of technology and money went into this attraction. Very well done, good staff, lots and lots of sea life. Would definitely recommend to anyone in Veracruz. \nThe only thing I can be irritated about, is that their bathroom facilities are lacking. No toilet paper, no toilet seats, no soap.. was disappointed a bit.

487506001.name: Worth the visit
487506001.author: a TripAdvisor user
487506001.reviewBody: Nothing spectacular but very nice.  Kids will love it.  On the malecon just before downtown.  One of very few things to do here... Not much to see or do.

482117321.name: Go with friends, go with kids!
482117321.author: a TripAdvisor user
482117321.reviewBody:
I happened to go with two friends, we had an amazing time they host a lot of species from the region, the plain visit to the aquarium may be around 2 hours, but you can also buy packages to swim with dolphins or interact with penguins. 
We tried to go on Saturday and it was super busy, the line to buy tickets was huge, a guy told us that you can buy tickets also at an ice cream shop with the logo of a monkey at the same plaza. But we decided to come back the next day hopping to find less people. Sunday was much a better day to visit, and move around the aquarium. Entrance tickets are 130 Mexican Pesos  

I swam with dolphins and the experience is great plus I believe it to be one of the cheapest places to swim with dolphins you can buy packages from as little as 500 Mexican pesos and the premium package is like 1200 Mexican pesos, pictures are a little expensive in comparison I got a package of 6 for like 600MXP but if you bring people with you they can take pictures from far too. 
 
In the complex of the aquarium they have two other museums, the Replay Museum and the Wax Museum , they try to sell you entrance tickets for those too in a package but I don't recommend visiting them they are very small, you can visit them in less than 15 min each. They do entertain you a bit if you decide to buy the packages.

481328607.name: You will walk in a glass enclosure surrounded by all sorts of marine life including huge sharks!
481328607.author: a TripAdvisor user
481328607.reviewBody: A nice aquatic experience.  Plan on 1-2 hours in order to fully enjoy this attraction.  The area also has other attractions such as Ripleys believe it or not and a lot of local open air markets.

481054054.name: Excellent value for a great aquarium
481054054.author: a TripAdvisor user
481054054.reviewBody: Not a lot to do in Veracruz if you stay more than 4 days, so be sure to try the Aquarium. The line-ups can be long on the weekends, so try going on a weekday in the morning. Great aquarium; was not disappointed. Great value (~130 pesos for an adult), lots to see.

479267908.name: We should not enjoy aquariums, but we do.
479267908.author: a TripAdvisor user
479267908.reviewBody: Aquarium of Veracruz was a very pleasant experience, they have many species, and kinds of fish, and also they have Dolphins and Sharks. I know that we should be responsible and not give money to this kind of attractions, but still is a great way to learn more about sea life.

477849225.name: Not to be missed
477849225.author: a TripAdvisor user
477849225.reviewBody: We recently paid a visit to the Veracruz Aquarium and it was a magnificent experience.  We arrived at the Aquarium around 10:00, an hour after opening and were pleased to find that the inevitable crowds had not yet overrun the place.  There were a lot of people there with us, but not so many that we could not see what we wanted when we wanted.  We were also able to take unobstructed photos and videos of the amazing variety of sea life on display in the beautifully arranged tanks.  It would be impossible to list everything that we saw; some of the highlights included manta rays that resembled great bats as the \u201cflew\u201d through the water, enormous and eerie moray eels, ghostly jellyfish, sharks and barracudas, many varieties of turtles, penguins, and the obligatory performing dolphins (which made us rather sad).  As you enter the aquarium there is an area that has many brilliantly-colored toucans, macaws and parrots flying free.  There are several opportunities to have a professional photo taken during your visit.  Go ahead and have the photos taken, you get the opportunity to review them at the end of your visit and decide if you want to purchase any of them (prints only).  Despite the rather steep price of 130 pesos each, we wound buying three.  We felt like awe-struck children during the entire visit.

475436091.name: interesting and alpt to take in
475436091.author: a TripAdvisor user
475436091.reviewBody: sea creatures and tanks with a variety of everything you will find in the water. even penguins and sharks, great way to spend 3 hrs

467678877.name: A Fun time to look
467678877.author: a TripAdvisor user
467678877.reviewBody: The Aquarium was a wonderful stop on a rainy day. My wife and I enjoyed the Sea Turtles and the Dolphins.  There were a few Huge tanks swarming with all sorts of Sea Life.  An enjoyable outing.

465048593.name: A pleasant surprise!
465048593.author: a TripAdvisor user
465048593.reviewBody: I usually stay away from zoos, etc. while traveling, but was pleasantly surprised by this aquarium. It has different tanks for different species (dolphins, sharks, jellyfish, penguins, manatees, tropical fish), and the dolphin show was quite entertaining. Tank signage is in English and Spanish. You can even sign up (and pay extra) to swim with the dolphins, pet the penguins, or submerge yourself in a shark cage!

463265411.name: Worth the visit
463265411.author: a TripAdvisor user
463265411.reviewBody: A worthwhile visit. Apparently the largest in Latin America.
