I haven\'t been to other aquaria in a long time so can\'t compare but there was a good flow lots of exhibits good info in 2 languages and good presentation There are additional for pay things like dolphin shows and penguin petting that are questionable but that is a personal observation. We had a wheelchair bound person and was not limited

459655389.name: A "must" in your travel
459655389.author: a TripAdvisor user
459655389.reviewBody: It is a great place to visit, the third bigger aquarium of the world. Enjoy the dolphins show around 1pm. My little baby loved it.

456949377.name: Nice and relaxing
456949377.author: a TripAdvisor user
456949377.reviewBody: This time I visited the aquarium.  Well maintained facilities with beautiful fishes and dolphins.  I am glad that I spend 2 hours there. Compere with the Varna Delphinium.... actually it can\'t be compared because of the completely different sea/ocean environment :-D \nHighly recommended to be seen!

456498022.name: Wonderful exhibits with plenty to do
456498022.author: a TripAdvisor user
456498022.reviewBody:
Definitely money well spent.  Spacious, clean exhibits - everything from parrots to dolphins!  Hands-on experiences along the way.  

Lots of room for children and adults to explore and take it all in.

Allow plenty of time to see everything!   The dolphin exhibit is stunning as you can watch them from below as the trainers are working with them.  And at the top?  Beautiful ocean view!

455426627.name: Great experience!
455426627.author: a TripAdvisor user
455426627.reviewBody: This was a small but great aquarium! You must do the swim with the dolphins! it\'s an amazing experience well worth it and most importantly it\'s not as expensive as other places!

454110172.name: Top Class Aquarium
454110172.author: a TripAdvisor user
454110172.reviewBody: The Aquarium is beautiful, it matches up against any of the other top aquariums in the world. There are plenty of exhibits to spend a good amount of time in it. Personally enjoyed the main tank a lot, its filled with many different species all in one main tank that surrounds you 360 degrees.

454016046.name: Fantastic
454016046.author: a TripAdvisor user
454016046.reviewBody: The best aquarium in Latin America, I believe. Facilities are well maintained and shows are very good. They feature different sections including an Amazon fish. It\'s a nice attraction with large facilities to enjoy the day. Must go.

453481401.name: Great way to spend less than $7
453481401.author: a TripAdvisor user
453481401.reviewBody: I visited the aquarium this evening and loved it. They offer many exhibits with numerous fish, birds, turtles and dolphins. Very educational! Most of the displays offered English too.

449753321.name: Visit to the aquarium
449753321.author: a TripAdvisor user
449753321.reviewBody: This is a must go place in Veracruz. The place is well maintained. And the attractions are ok. It is not spectacular but good enough for the kids and family. Possible to swim with dolphins. Buy the photos offered!! Good quality!!

447598590.name: Very nice spot to see local nature
447598590.author: a TripAdvisor user
447598590.reviewBody: One of the oldest aquariums in Mexico. Used to be the largest in Latin America. It starts with a room where the local wild life is shown. Then you will get into the fishbowls with several kinds of species, locals, nationals and internationals. There is two great spots here: The oceanic room, which is a 360 tank and you can see the wide ocean species swimming around you. Impressive. The other spot is the shark tank, it has a tunnel where you will see the sharks coming in front of your eyes and above your head. They also have a penguin tank, a dolphin tank and a "Manati" tank, which is a endemic specie... beautiful!

447213899.name: Excellent place to visit
447213899.author: a TripAdvisor user
447213899.reviewBody: It\u00b4s an excellent place to visit with all family, You could visit it all time in year, people is awesome and helpul.

440023060.name: Great place to go
440023060.author: a TripAdvisor user
440023060.reviewBody:
We really enjoyed this aquarium. You can see many fishes and delphin show which was great. 

The price is 125 mx for adult and we spend there about 2 hours. 

I would recommend this especially with family

All info are also in english

437774211.name: Finding Dory
437774211.author: a TripAdvisor user
437774211.reviewBody: The aquarium facilities are fine. Nice variety of underwater life and very educational. Perhaps is not as big as other aquarium but you will get not dissapointed

436812026.name: great place, especially for children
436812026.author: a TripAdvisor user
436812026.reviewBody: The Veracruz\' Aquarium is not comparable to the big and fascinating aquariums in the US, as Boston, Baltimore etc., but it\'s a great place, especially for children, where you can spend easily half a day.

429130849.name: Educational fun
429130849.author: a TripAdvisor user
429130849.reviewBody: I went to the aquarium with a family from Canada who has been at least five times. The aquarium is not particularly big if you\'ve been to others in the States. However, it loops around and uses all of its space efficiently. I enjoyed the circular room with an amphitheater in it because all the fish swam around you the entire time. The dolphin show was fun, though short and only happened twice the day we were there. \n\nIf you have big bucks to spend there are a few extras you can pay for: swimming with dolphins or sharks or meet a penguin.

424834948.name: Nice Aquarium
424834948.author: a TripAdvisor user
424834948.reviewBody: It is a very nice aquarium that if you have the time to visit. Is representative of some species from the zone, and some other from around the world, it will take you 2 hours unless you decide for the penguins tour that will take around 3 hours.

420214487.name: Nice place
420214487.author: a TripAdvisor user
420214487.reviewBody: take the time to visit this place, specially if you have kids, this will be great, shark and penguins experience for less than a 40 us dlls

404070930.name: Very good and very busy.
404070930.author: a TripAdvisor user
404070930.reviewBody: The kids love it! Especially and predictably the dolphins.\nVery informative about local beasts.\nIt is not conveniently located: in a shopping mall on the edge of town.

403422001.name: Pretty good aquarium truthfully
403422001.author: a TripAdvisor user
403422001.reviewBody: So overall a very good place. I\'d never seen a tiger shark before or a manatee and both were here. Lots of small exhibits and a few large ones. The penguin display was pretty boring. We paid 120 Pesos for two kids to touch a dolphin. In the states that would cost you $50 probably. The map of Texas and Louisiana they had was poorly drawn (see photo). Lots of cool things in the same building like Ripleys and a wax museum, restaurants, the beach is right outside, and ice cream. Great area to spend an entire afternoon.

401789781.name: Nice experience
401789781.author: a TripAdvisor user
401789781.reviewBody: Beautiful experience. Very well organized. Must stay for the dolphin show. I recommend it to others..

401259027.name: Used to be better
401259027.author: a TripAdvisor user
401259027.reviewBody: The Aquarium in few past years use to be better, more clean and organized, animal were more cared. Presently the price do no represent the attraction.

397467626.name: Eh....it used to be better
397467626.author: a TripAdvisor user
397467626.reviewBody: The Aquarium used to be better.  The collection of animals is still nice however the presentation is dated.  The day we were there it was extremely humid and hot inside.  The walls were in need of paint and some of the exhibits were no longer functioning.The dolphin shows needs seating.

397055463.name: Need to visit
397055463.author: a TripAdvisor user
397055463.reviewBody: This was a stop on a cruise I was on and this was one of the stops. The tour was amazing. There was a statue of some children who threw themselves over a cliff with the flag. It was all about the country being taken over during that time years ago. It was sad to listen to this during the tour. But overall I love the city, I guess cause it\'s somewhere I\'ve never been but I would love to go back.  Beautiful city.

395314020.name: Excellent adventure
395314020.author: a TripAdvisor user
395314020.reviewBody:
Don't miss the Aquarium in Veracruz, but be sure to go on a day when it isn't too crowded.  You might want to call ahead or inquire.  

I went on a weekday early, and was able to get in before the rush of children and parents came through.  I'm sure it's busy all the time, but plan if you can.

The Aquarium is situated in a big "shopping" tourist mall, and there is a VIP's restaurant attached, so you can have breakfast there and then walk a short distance over to the Aquarium.  When you get in the ticket line, you are offered a couple of options - the Aquarium alone or the Aquarium and the Wax Museum - I don't really care much for Wax Museums, so I only purchased the Aquarium ticket.

Like Aquariums all over the world, this one is set up in a way that is easily maneuvered by the regular person with or without children.  Lots of small and large and huge aquariums with lots and lots of fish of every variety.  I spent a good two hours there, took lots of pictures, and had a great time.  But I love Aquariums.

At certain hours, they have a "dolphin show" - so if you are there and can get a seat or close view, try to do so.  It is fun and entertaining and free.

I had a great time there and would highly recommend it to anyone who loves this kind of things.

395115377.name: Amazing Place!
395115377.author: a TripAdvisor user
395115377.reviewBody: I have been to the Aquarium many times and every single time I love it more! It is definitely one of the must-visit places in Veracruz!

384133279.name: VISITING SAN DIEGO.CAL.
384133279.author: a TripAdvisor user
384133279.reviewBody: I recently visited San Diego, California on May 2016. A very worldwide recognized medical meeting called DDW (Digestive Disease Week) was on that beautiful city on the West.  It is a medical-surgical meeting that gather literally thousand of doctors form all over the world and during a week. They share experiences all about Gastrointestinal Diseases related to research, clinical and surgical treatments and advances. Visiting the beautiful city of San Diego, on the Bay of California, it has been a wonderful experience. Nice warm weather, excellent tourism infrastructure (Hotels, Restaurants and Amenities and Activities) and a City in my experience, well prepared to have visitors.

382966337.name: Good break from the sun.
382966337.author: a TripAdvisor user
382966337.reviewBody: Very good aquarium located beachside. Excellent self directed walk through the many tanks including a dolphin show. You can get a combination ticket to the wax museum and Ripley\'s. Wax museum was good also.

381416106.name: Awesome aquarium!
381416106.author: a TripAdvisor user
381416106.reviewBody: So many things to see! HUGE tank with sharks in it. My 2 and 4 year old were so excited when they saw all the fish and dolphins!

373554218.name: Aquarium
373554218.author: a TripAdvisor user
373554218.reviewBody: The best !!!! A reality good time in family !!!\nI hope I Will Back soon \nMy kids love dolphins and the biggest manat\u00ed

361676709.name: big aquarium
361676709.author: a TripAdvisor user
361676709.reviewBody: this aquarium has a wide variety of species, people is nice and there is always somebody to explain exhibitions.\nsharks and stingray are amazing.\nthey offer a photo service which I think it\'s expensive (about 10 USD each)

352985925.name: Loved the birds!
352985925.author: a TripAdvisor user
352985925.reviewBody: The sharks are large and float overhead in a cool sunken aquarium while the jellyfish have neon lights that make good photos. The only letdown was the plain dolphin tank... I can see why some mammals go crazy.

351283121.name: Nice Aquarium and affordable dolphin swims
351283121.author: a TripAdvisor user
351283121.reviewBody:
We had planned to catch an afternoon bus on to our next destination but spent a few hours here first.

We pre-booked a swimming with dolphins session over the internet at 11:35 but arrived around 10 as entry to the aquarium is included in the price.  We were able to store our heavy backpacks free for 3 hours and longer for a very small fee.

We had a slow walk around the aquarium and saw a lovely toucan and many turtles before reaching the otters and manatees and plenty of other fish to see too.  at 11 we went out back to watch the dolphin show of which there are 4 each day.

After the show we were guided 'backstage' where we donned wetsuits and removed most piercings before being taken out to the main pool.  We were given some basic instructions and then entered the pool where we were introduced to Jami and Benito, the 2 dolphins.

The dolphins swam around us for a long time and between all tricks.  The things we experienced included being pulled along by their fins, kisses, clapping but none were as amazing as the dolphin ride where you lie in the water and they push your feet until your standing up whilst moving across the pool.  I would recommend this to anyone.

After the swim we were given towels and access to hot showers ans then we were sold affordable pictures from the swim.

Near the main entrance there is an ice cream stall which does excellent affordable ice creams in a range of interesting flavours.

If this is a maybe for you then make it a yes right now and book a place, it really is worth it.

The price was around US $50 MEX $750 GBP £30  Which is remarkable cheap.  Compared to Cancun where prices start at at least 3 times this.

347767518.name: Excellent experience...
347767518.author: a TripAdvisor user
347767518.reviewBody: Very nice Aquarium!\na "must do"  when you are in Veracruz!\nEven without kids worth a visit and a very calming experience...

345280660.name: Worth a visit
345280660.author: a TripAdvisor user
345280660.reviewBody: My partner and I visited the aquarium and were not disappointed.  We hadn\u00b4t planned on the dolphin show but arrived just before it started and were directed there by staff.  The trainers are amazing.  I prefer dolphins in the wild but couldn\u00b4t help but be impressed by the surfing on the dolphins backs and standing on the nose.  The exhibitions are interesting and well explained and contain the local fish of the area which is always interesting.  We went on a Monday morning and there was no line to get in.

344833902.name: a large aquarium
344833902.author: a TripAdvisor user
344833902.reviewBody: A very large aquarium. You walk through a kind of gass tunel where sharks and turtles swim around. Easy to visit by bus.

343394515.name: Nice visit
343394515.author: a TripAdvisor user
343394515.reviewBody: We had a short visit this last month and it was great. Although the place is a little bit old, they seem to do a great job on shows and explanations. The big tank works fine and they also offer dolphin shows. I recommend giving it a try. also the entrance fee is very convenient.

339274182.name: Purchase tickets online and print them!!
339274182.author: a TripAdvisor user
339274182.reviewBody: To be fare, we didn\'t visit the aquarium, we waited on line for about 1 hour and realize that we will have to wait at least 1 more hour just to go in so we left. \nWe found out that there was no line for the entrance just to purchase tickets.

334694165.name: Aquarium right next to the beach : Acuario cerca de la playa, una diversion unicameral!
334694165.author: a TripAdvisor user
334694165.reviewBody: It was great to see family members excited to see for the first time the sea world experience in Veracruz.  Besides excitement and curiosity, it has been memorable educational experience as well!

334330727.name: Great for kids!
334330727.author: a TripAdvisor user
334330727.reviewBody: I used to go as a kid. It was amazing. Even now as an adult, I like going with my little cousins. I might take my kids whenever I have. I don\'t live in Veracruz nor Mexico. But I have cool memories there .

330406992.name: Visit Veracruz aquarium
330406992.author: a TripAdvisor user
330406992.reviewBody: I really liked this very nice aquarium you also very well attend in hotels and restaurants is a pretty wonder ful thing its coast and its city \n

330165075.name: Good experience.... must see
330165075.author: a TripAdvisor user
330165075.reviewBody: If you go to Veracruz, you must see......  is a great experience specially the show at the end.   They open late so if you go, plan arriving after 10am.

329576927.name: View Dolphin "show" in Cool Area
329576927.author: a TripAdvisor user
329576927.reviewBody: Enjoyed the dolphins and the human performance from inside/below the display. Had perfect view, away from the elements and took some awesome pictures. I was the only visitor at bottom level. If you\'ve previously seen such spectacle then you may want to try this perspective.

321259773.name: Amazing experience at Delfiniti!
321259773.author: a TripAdvisor user
321259773.reviewBody: The experience with the Dolphins still alive is a magic time and connection with a amazing spirit mammals! \nI recommend this place the Delfiniti is worth it for a little fraction of the real price in USA for it  Cain of experience.\nI was 35 minutes the best time in my whole life!

321257589.name: Good for kids
321257589.author: a TripAdvisor user
321257589.reviewBody:
This review is based on my 6 year old son's experience because he loves to visit Zoos and Aquariums. 
He really liked the complete experience, specially the penguins because they have an area where only kids are allowed, and it has a glass floor where they can walk on; the penguins swim under it, so they have them really close.
Almost at the end of the aquarium, they have a dolphin tank where you can see them from "ground level" and also "under water" through a big glass window.
Now for my personal review.. They have a different selection than most of the aquariums, a specific one I liked is the glowing jellyfish, I've never seen one before and it looks amazing.

319372980.name: Great Aquarium!
319372980.author: a TripAdvisor user
319372980.reviewBody: Fantastic location and nice selection of fish and wild life. The talking parrot was amazing! We did the package deal with swimming with the Dolphins which was well worth the money. Grant it, we visited in off season, so the price was significantly lower. The views of the Gulf of Mexico from the top were beautiful. Well worth the money.

311941524.name: The best of its kind
311941524.author: a TripAdvisor user
311941524.reviewBody: Just great, the best place in Veracruz (in all latinamerica too)  of its kind. Very well designed, clean,  efficient, great service. Totally worth the time and money. A must see in Veracruz.

307302129.name: Make sure your camera can take good pictures without flash.
307302129.author: a TripAdvisor user
307302129.reviewBody: Clean, interesting assortment of specimens and good guides to make the visit even more meaningful.  Prices were reasonable.

305171210.name: Fantastic!!!!
305171210.author: a TripAdvisor user
305171210.reviewBody: It was my first time coming here and I was not disappointed. My family and I enjoyed every single minute of it. It was very packed but other then that we had a great time. Can\'t wait to come back!

304242028.name: Aqua Veracruz !
304242028.author: a TripAdvisor user
304242028.reviewBody: I remember the last time i came here , beautiful,nice environment clean and very cool aquarium ,like the sharks also the pejelagartos which are very interesting and rare animals,if you are aroun the area feel free to come here and expend some real good time with your family,you ll definitely have a blast! \nRemember like verecruz there\'s nt two!

303415031.name: A little depressing
303415031.author: a TripAdvisor user
303415031.reviewBody: The dolphin show was one of the best I\'ve ever seen but the animals tanks were small and dirty so that was a little depressing

293685899.name: Fabulous!!!!
293685899.author: a TripAdvisor user
293685899.reviewBody: Fabulous aquarium!   Nice dophin show!   Great exhibits - AND the opportunity to swim with the dolphins and become part of the show (for an extra fee).   REally nice!

293479244.name: Simply...Amazing
293479244.author: a TripAdvisor user
293479244.reviewBody: I had gone to this aquarium when I was 8 years old and last time I went was after all the renovations and I was just was amazed with all the displays and how modern everything looked. Very nice installations and family friendly, I went with my little sisters and nephew and we had a really good time.

288114375.name: Good for families
288114375.author: a TripAdvisor user
288114375.reviewBody: For me it\'s no different to the other aquariums I visited except that it\'s larger and contains a shark tank and a dolphin tank. But it\'s worth visiting if you\'re in Veracruz and if you have children with you then it\'s even better as it makes for a good family outing especially when showing your child different kinds of tropical fish.\n\nIt is located along the seafront of Veracruz so it\'s not difficult to find.

281984100.name: nice
281984100.author: a TripAdvisor user
281984100.reviewBody: Very interesting and beutiful place aspecially for families. I hope will be back there as soon is possible.

281969672.name: It is really nice
281969672.author: a TripAdvisor user
281969672.reviewBody: I have to say it is really beautiful and the animals are treated well. The only minus point is that they offer "swimming with Delphine" I think that means a lot of stress for the animals

277783795.name: Very nicely done
277783795.author: a TripAdvisor user
277783795.reviewBody: Hats off to Vera Cruz, we\'ve been to a lot of zoos in Mexico and some are very sad for the animals and we hate to see that but great care has been taken at the Acuario de Veracriz to create beautiful habitats, the animals look well cared for and the emphasis throughout all the exhibits is education and conservation. We really enjoyed our visit as a couple! Definitely try to go on off hours / days or you are in for a crowd, we visited on a rainy Monday morning and never had to wait or peer over stranger\'s heads to see.

277632522.name: Great experience
277632522.author: a TripAdvisor user
277632522.reviewBody: Had tons of fun when I went to the Aquarium, I was very young and have great memories.  I look forward to returning soon.

277364706.name: Pleasant surprise
277364706.author: a TripAdvisor user
277364706.reviewBody: This place is bigger than you expect when you enter. It has big variety of animals from the sea. The labeling is good and very informativ. You can easily spend an hour or two inside. Worth checking out!

277077951.name: Must see in Veracruz
277077951.author: a TripAdvisor user
277077951.reviewBody:
Entertaining
Nice sea animals
Good shows - dolphins
Good location
Lots of fun
Pretty souvenirs
Beautiful wáter takns

275345472.name: There for a holiday? get ready for LONG lines
275345472.author: a TripAdvisor user
275345472.reviewBody: The aquarium itself is very nice. I like the addition/extension they did to it and overall it\'s been well kept. That being said, it\'s on a somewhat run-down mall that has low quality stores. I think if VIPs leaves that mall it will probably bring everything down with it. I wish they would have better stores there.\n\nWith regards to the aquarium experience... we were there during the new years holiday and easily waited an hour in line to get in. It was SUPER crowded and you would be lucky to see any fish. Anyhow, I think it\'s an ok place to visit as long as you don\'t go during the super busy season. Otherwise good luck finding where to park and seeing any fish.

268734770.name: A must
268734770.author: a TripAdvisor user
268734770.reviewBody: You can get to this place by bus or walking, it\'s really beautiful and not expensive, for a little more you can enter to two other museums, inside they take a lot of pics of you doing amazing stuff and you can buy them later! Don\'t miss the dolphins show, and if you have the money/time swim with them. The only bad point? You cant go back after you\'ve been to penguins, so don\'t leave anything for later.

268413196.name: Interesting and Good Family Fun
268413196.author: a TripAdvisor user
268413196.reviewBody: Whether you\'re here by yourself or with your family this is a good place to visit in the city.  The price is reasonable and they have a lot to see.  They have short dolphin shows throughout the morning and afternoon along with photo ops with the dolphins.  The main room, in which you are surrounded by the aquarium itself, is worth the price of admission.  They recently added penguins to the aquarium so you can look forward to seeing them at the end of your tour.  There are some displays that are not so spectacular but this is a worthwhile place to visit in the city.  Also, a little locals knowledge, if you\'re looking to buy trinkets and souvenirs to take home then the shops outside of the aquarium are better quality then what you\'ll find at the Malecon.

267444359.name: A very enjoyable visit
267444359.author: a TripAdvisor user
267444359.reviewBody: Great place to avoid the midday heat!  Very well organized, with tropical birds, penguins, jellyfish, turtles and a wonderful reef display.  I dislike the idea of captive dolphins in general, and this tank was really somewhat inadequate, but otherwise, especially mid week, this asI as good an aquarium as one is likely to findin mexico.  Packets also include the wax museum and the Rip,es Museum, if that\'s your idea of a good time.  We just did the aquarium.  Quite enjoyable

263780759.name: better than expected
263780759.author: a TripAdvisor user
263780759.reviewBody: A very nice aquarium. Lots of variety. And the best: giant sharks!! and I mean giant.The only thing i did not like was the dolphin enclosure.

261955376.name: Kids will love it
261955376.author: a TripAdvisor user
261955376.reviewBody: Very nice aquarium, very clean. Lots of marine life to see. Areas where you can see the fish swimming over top as you walk through. My husband was disappointed there were no octopus.Oh well can\'t have everything.There is people selling clothing in the building also, so you can shop while there. And a food area.

261656408.name: Nice place just to hang out
261656408.author: a TripAdvisor user
261656408.reviewBody: We visited with some friends trying to kill some time. It was very enjoyable, there were many spots that you could take pictures with different animals like birds, turtles, penguins and sea lions. I believe they offer a special options to feed the sharks as well but we did not do this part, but we were able to see them through a glass. At the end there was a dolphin show which was nice, very basic stuff in a small pool.

260645668.name: Nice aquarium (but poor dolphins)
260645668.author: a TripAdvisor user
260645668.reviewBody: Overall a great aquarium. I am a diver and the experience is pretty similar to the one you get down in the sea. I still believe the dolphins have very little space.

260073794.name: Best aquarium in Mexico
260073794.author: a TripAdvisor user
260073794.reviewBody: I believe this is the best aquarium in Mexico, it has couple of years but it is well preserved and always trying to add exhibitions. It is one of the main attractions to the city of Veracruz and our family enjoyed the exhibitions, the fish, loved the sharks, dolphins and penguins. Although we visited on Saturday, it was well controlled and we took the time to enjoy what our kids wanted to see with more attention. It totally worth the visit

257354942.name: It was worth the trip.
257354942.author: a TripAdvisor user
257354942.reviewBody: Spent around 2-3 hours here and found it a nice worthwhile visit with a lot to see and do for all ages. They have a lot of fish and some times they looked a bit cramped for the size of the tanks, especially the bigger fish.

254844509.name: The best aquarium in America latina.
254844509.author: a TripAdvisor user
254844509.reviewBody: This aquarium has everything and all species in the one area which is well laid out.\nChildren and adults alike, will be very impressed with the thickness of the glass and the fact that it is so clean and clear.\n

253732938.name: enjoyed it
253732938.author: a TripAdvisor user
253732938.reviewBody: The aquarium is quite far from the city centre, but a 30 peso taxi ride will take you there (or 9 pesos on a local bus).  Entrance was 120 pesos and was well worth it.  Be sure to ask the times of the dolphin show.  The aquarium is attached to a shopping mall with a VIPS restaurant which offers 20 % discount with aquarium tickets.  We had a nice, easy lunch there.  There menu has pictures which is helpful if your Spanish is as bad as mine.   Nice staff.  The mall has a few quality shops and a wax museum (which we didn\'t visit).  Outside the aquarium, you can walk along the shore where there are some beach restaurants, lots of seagulls and brown pelicans.

252957954.name: Lots of fun for the family
252957954.author: a TripAdvisor user
252957954.reviewBody: It\'s a bit dated now but it\'s very well set up, informative and fun. My kids loved it, as did I. Way better than the Mexico City Aquarium (which just opened).

241309062.name: Aquarium is nice add-on
241309062.author: a TripAdvisor user
241309062.reviewBody: The aquarium was an extra add on to our package in Veracruz and it turned out to be a very nice experience. They have a good variety of fish and animals. Very interesting.

239665731.name: Fishes, turtles and much more ...
239665731.author: a TripAdvisor user
239665731.reviewBody: A very nice acquarium to enjoy while visiting Veracruz ... it has a wonderful selection of fishes, ryes, turtles, and all you\'d expect from a first-class acquarium ... a must-visit in the port !

238256188.name: Amazing Place
238256188.author: a TripAdvisor user
238256188.reviewBody: I\'ve been to different aquariums and dolphinariums but this is something exceptional. Show with dolphins will not leave you indifferent. Great place to relax and feel yourself part of nature.

237147460.name: Nice place to spend part of a hot afternoon
237147460.author: a TripAdvisor user
237147460.reviewBody: The aquarium has grown over the years and now includes dolphins and penguins. Clean and neat and delightfully dark and cool. I went on a weekday afternoon and it wasn\'t crowded at all. Weekends Vera Cruz fills up and I would imagine there would be a lot of families then. I have walked past it a number of times on weekends and the outside is plenty busy so I\'d imagine that\'s a clue to whats going on inside. It isn\'t just an aquarium, there are several other attractions under the same roof, shops, a food court and a "VIPS" restaurant. (Think Denny\'s)\n\nNot the best aquarium I\'ve visited, but far from the worst.

232681381.name: Not to be missed in Veracruz
232681381.author: a TripAdvisor user
232681381.reviewBody: This is hands down the best attraction in Veracruz. The aquarium is on par with those in any major city. Exhibits are varied and well done. The aquarium has a flow that keeps people moving. There is a nice mixture of exhibits and educational experiences for kids and adults. The large tank has some impressive fish and a good number of sharks. You can swim with them for a fee. the manatee tank is also very interesting - not something you see in all places. The dolphin tank is also very cool. They do several shows a day. We did the dolphin experience, spending about 40 minutes in the tank with these magnificent creatures! It was reasonably priced compared to other places. They have a photographer that captures all the pictures for you. They are pricey, but the quality of shots was good. Highly recommended!

231824839.name: Not worth a visit on a weekend
231824839.author: a TripAdvisor user
231824839.reviewBody: We went on a Saturday so that could be why is was less enjoyable because it was very packed with people. But I wasn\'t to impressed, nothing stood out and we did miss the dolphin show. So maybe that wold have been cool? It was worth the 3 package deal with the Aquarium, Ripley\'s believe it or not museum and the wax museum. The shopping in the mall there is pretty fun as well, I would say look around at the shops as well for some fun things!

231732691.name: Feed the sharks is a must!
231732691.author: a TripAdvisor user
231732691.reviewBody: Loved the friendly people, prices are accessible, tip: dont buy the tickets to feed the sharks ahead of time, its cheaper if you buy them while in the aquarium, your entrance is credited toward the price  of the ticket to feed the sharks.

227551475.name: Excellent Aquarium in Veracruz!
227551475.author: a TripAdvisor user
227551475.reviewBody: This is really an amazing engineering marvel, with a great fish selection. Very easy to arrive there with lots of options (public bus, taxi, not expensive at all). If you want to experience to be as close as you can to the Sharks, visit the tube hallway and be ready to be amazed!, 110% recommended.

226804434.name: Amazed
226804434.author: a TripAdvisor user
226804434.reviewBody: I loved the aquarium. So many different species, all that I\'ve wanted to see and know about the life in the ocean was in one place.

226766541.name: great visit
226766541.author: a TripAdvisor user
226766541.reviewBody: a must see while in Veracruz! A very complete aquarium that the whole family will enjoy visiting. We\'ve gone quite a few times and there seems to be something new with each visit!

226349177.name: Very nice
226349177.author: a TripAdvisor user
226349177.reviewBody: The Acquarium of Veracruz is very nice. There is usually a long queue at the entrance, but it is quite fast. To avoid it, be there very soon when it opens.

222841481.name: Very good
222841481.author: a TripAdvisor user
222841481.reviewBody: Many types of fishes, included sharks, dolphins and penguins... very nice! The ticket price is quite low, in my opinion fully deserved.

216967030.name: great place to visit with your chidren
216967030.author: a TripAdvisor user
216967030.reviewBody: the Aquarium at Veracruz is a must during your visit to Veracruz, the kids enjoy the diversity of fished and sea life besides there are a couple of attractions like the delphins show and the time to feed the sharks. You will not regret your visit to the place

215144068.name: Good family visit
215144068.author: a TripAdvisor user
215144068.reviewBody: This was a pretty good Aquarium even my 3 year old was entertained. The dolphin show was impressive but I think they need to build tiered standing areas because it\'s harder to see in the back. They are about to open a penguin exhibit but it wasn\'t ready yet. I thought I read that they had a touch tank where you could touch some fish but I never saw one. We went through pretty fast because we were following the attention span of a 3 year old but you could probably spend a couple hours here.

207269305.name: Fun at the Aquarium !!!
207269305.author: a TripAdvisor user
207269305.reviewBody: One of the biggest aquariums in Latin america, is a great choice to spend the day visiting all its different aisles and regions .. the Oceanic fish bowl is impressive with all they sharks and rays. New dolphin show and you can also swim with them .. which is quite good priced compared to some other shows ;-)  Higly recommend !!!

204273034.name: Veracruz aquarium and city tour
204273034.author: a TripAdvisor user
204273034.reviewBody: If you are planning to visit Veracruz, Mexico, I highly recommend getting in touch with the English speaking guide Enrique Sanchez Bello who gave me a wonderful guided tour of the city:  he shared many interesting stories about the city, its inhabitants, cultural events, etc.  Enrique is a philosopher, historian and kin observer of life.  His contacts: 229 183-7857 mulukahau@hotmail.com\n\nAquarium was a bit sad - I was recently in Monterrey Bay and you can\'t even compare....

202912694.name: Great Aquarium
202912694.author: a TripAdvisor user
202912694.reviewBody: Was my second visit.  They have really added more and I was impressed. Great tanks with sharks, Rays, ETC.  Most information in both Spanish and English.  Very inexpensive for what you see. It was also nice to support the growing Eco movement in Mexico.  They are now actively preserving reefs, working on  recycling, and air pollution.   One of the best I have seen after Atlanta and Monterrey.

202177556.name: Amazing Aquarium
202177556.author: a TripAdvisor user
202177556.reviewBody: Veracruz Aquarium is perhaps the most impressive attraction in Veracruz aside from their folk music and dance mainly for the huge effort that requires to maintain this impressive aquarium. i was amazed by all the big number of species that they portrait.

201543437.name: Too many people
201543437.author: a TripAdvisor user
201543437.reviewBody: It was fine. Just a lot of people; and a lot of workers with microphones yelling out instructions. A bit annoying

199455745.name: Fantastic
199455745.author: a TripAdvisor user
199455745.reviewBody: I really liked with the Aquarium: its variety of fish made the visit the highlight of my trip. There a little too much people, which makes it a bit hot, so dress accordingly. The central hall, surrounded by a massive tank, is breathtaking. The dolphin show was alright.

198290950.name: Well worth a visit
198290950.author: a TripAdvisor user
198290950.reviewBody: The aquarium was much better than expected. Very scientific and educational, all signs in faultless English, clean and in good repair. It is not very large, you can see everything in less than one hour. The entrance is from a rather tacky mall with a wax museum and a Ripley\'s and other cheap stuff, but don\'t let that discourage you. The aquarium had a high standard, clearly international class.

196220459.name: Well worth the price
196220459.author: a TripAdvisor user
196220459.reviewBody: I\'ve been to several aquariums and this one is very good for the price.  The number of aquariums was impressive. The dolphin show was unexpected and entertaining.  Well worth a visit.

193006019.name: "World Class" Aquarium
193006019.author: a TripAdvisor user
193006019.reviewBody: Part of a network with other well known aquariums such as the one in Monterrey, California.  Well thought out, educational and interesting.  Strongly suggest you don\'t miss the dolphin show.

192177223.name: Swim with the Dolphins
192177223.author: a TripAdvisor user
192177223.reviewBody: A friend visited us in Veracruz and wanted to swim with the dolphins.  We took him to the aquarium.  He really enjoyed swimming with them but he did feel that they were more interesting in selling photos afterwards. So during the swim he was asked to pose over and over with the dolphins.  They photos were of good quality though.

191756232.name: Excellent place
191756232.author: a TripAdvisor user
191756232.reviewBody: We really enjoyed the aquarium very well kept nice place to visitwith family. Walking distance from the hotel if you like to walk along the ocean

190783702.name: short visit 3 days
190783702.author: a TripAdvisor user
190783702.reviewBody: a very fine display of marine species not expensive a good day out close to city center fine for the whole family

190220691.name: Must visit if in Veracruz
190220691.author: a TripAdvisor user
190220691.reviewBody: A definite visit if you have small children. My daughter absolutely loved the place.\nThey also have a dolphin show which was quite good...\nYou also have the option of combining the trip with a visit to the Wax Museum and The Ripleys Museum which are located in the same complex.

188768169.name: Excellent acuarium
188768169.author: a TripAdvisor user
188768169.reviewBody: I think this is the best attraction in Veracruz! The place is well maintained and has a excellent exhibit. They also have sea turtle breeding programs and support other conservation activities in the region

188153606.name: Great Experience
188153606.author: a TripAdvisor user
188153606.reviewBody: I really enjoyed my time spent at the aquarium! In the same building, there are shops, a food courts, Ripley\'s museum and a wax museum too. The aquarium was great, there were so many animals to see that we spent a few hours there. I would definitely recommend this for a family or couple.

185909129.name: They have a shark cage!
185909129.author: a TripAdvisor user
185909129.reviewBody: They have some excellent exhibits.  I spent several hours there and enjoyed the dolphin show.  I was interested in the shark cage adventure.  It costs extra and no one was actually doing it while I was there so I didn\'t see what they do but it looked fun.\nIn the aquarium complex you will find a large air conditioned Mall area with good shopping and a food court area as well.

185772609.name: Well maintained and with several specimens
185772609.author: a TripAdvisor user
185772609.reviewBody: I really enjoyed visiting this aquarium because we had the opportunity to see sharks and even dolphins. Has several species of fish and even manatees. The aquarium is very well maintained and the service is very good. I highly recommend it.

183724011.name: Read this
183724011.author: a TripAdvisor user
183724011.reviewBody: You can pay 8 dollars and entre ti ripleys museum And cera too. Its small acuarium Bit its ver good. Whe you finished both museums u can walk around the plaza oe but curios inside. Or you can out from there and enjoy walking at the malecon .or take the tranvia for five dollars and get the fulk tour to the malecon.u can tske the tranvia outside the acuarium. Its a enjoy and happy tour with music and lights

178567078.name: Great place to visit
178567078.author: a TripAdvisor user
178567078.reviewBody: Very good collection.  Good dolphin show.  Great place for children to learn.  Even you can swim with dolphin.

177562714.name: Very nice.
177562714.author: a TripAdvisor user
177562714.reviewBody:
A must see in veracruz. I know that there is a lot of aquariums around the world better than this one, but this one is the first aquarium in Mexico that I can say is good.

There is a lot of sharks, rays, exotic fishes,turtles, they are clean and healthy. 

Very good option for couples or childrens.

175465385.name: Nice local atraction
175465385.author: a TripAdvisor user
175465385.reviewBody: Prices are great to swim with dolphins and sharks! A must if you are in town! Hat lots of fun with the family and friends!

174175710.name: Dancing porpoises need a stage
174175710.author: a TripAdvisor user
174175710.reviewBody: The aquarium has all the standard tanks of fish from the area. Good but nothing out of the ordinary if you have been to an aquarium previously.  What is unique is their porpoise display.  The tank holds three porpoises who put on a show each day.  They are well trained and do a great act.  The problem is that the viewing area is on one level and when I was there on a Saturday people were 5 to 6 deep and other than the first two rows of people could see most of the act.  The aquarium easily has the area next to the tank to build a grandstand of 6 levels so all of the audience could see the whole act.

169673951.name: A nice aquarium to visit
169673951.author: a TripAdvisor user
169673951.reviewBody: A nice place to spend the afternoon. Modern and well kept with some nice displays .\n A group of nice gift stores and a great place to hide out from the sun since it is all A/C.

168934936.name: Worth the visit
168934936.author: a TripAdvisor user
168934936.reviewBody: If you have been to large aquariums like the one in Atlanta, GA., this is not going to surprise you, but the visit is very worth wile. If you have never been to an aquarium then you\'ll be very surprised. I definitely recommend you pay the $400 extra pesos for the experience to feed the sharks (in an acrylic cube!), you don\'t need to bring swimwear, they\'ll give you one free.

166107838.name: Very nice and interesting aquarium. The best in Mexico!
166107838.author: a TripAdvisor user
166107838.reviewBody: Clean, friendly staff, well planned. Very good air conditioning! An excelent way to spend the morning or evening with the kids, in a nice, and extensive acuarium. One of the best attractions of veracruz.

165356767.name: Don\'t expect much
165356767.author: a TripAdvisor user
165356767.reviewBody: I\'ve visited some aquariums in Europe which were really impressive. As far as I remember the one in Veracruz is claimed to be the biggest one in Mexico (?) so I was expecting to visit a huge place with many animals. Unfortunately I was wrong... Of course the animals were beautiful, enough information about them and it was a nice experience but I was disappointed with the size of this aquarium. It\'s ok to spend an hour or two over there especially if you have kids ;) but I wouldn\'t go there again.

158279164.name: Interesting presentation
158279164.author: a TripAdvisor user
158279164.reviewBody: The layout was interesting and the fish were shown in their natural like habitat. There was a wide variety of Gulf of Mexico fish. The price is reasonable and, although it is small, one could easily spend a couple hours  reading the interesting placards that identified the various species.

157538742.name: Aquarium - see sharks up close
157538742.author: a TripAdvisor user
157538742.reviewBody: A well organized small aquarium, with an impressive collection of sharks, rays and groupers.  We thought the Dolphin tank was rather small and so did not stay to watch the show.

154770591.name: Nothing impressive, but nice for a quiet day
154770591.author: a TripAdvisor user
154770591.reviewBody:
If you've been to aquariums like Monterrey, it's probably not going to do much for you.  I read beforehand that it was "the best in Latin America" and an amazing aquarium.  Regarding the former, that doesn't say much considering the developing status of most Latin American countries (which are my favorite) and regarding the latter...it's really just average.  

Overall it was ok.  I was surprised to see it in a mall and it could be better maintained.  The animals don't look as miserable those in the Mexico City Zoo, but some were just depressing to see, namely the pacu, sharks, and dolphins.  The pacu are numerous and the tank is quite tiny.  Same for the sharks, but comparative for their size.  Especially the lone tiger shark.  It was awesome to see such an amazing animal, but I couldn't help but feel bad for it.  He just swam in slow circles around the top of the tank and had some white stuff growing on his tail.  Looked pretty sad.  As for the dolphins, I really hope they have some other place they keep them because that tank is like a prison cell.  

All in all, it's worth the 100 pesos, but not much more.  When we got to the end I was really surprised. Couldn't believe it was so small.  It's interesting to the see the animals up close.  I'm not sure if I'd go back for any other reason but to feed the sharks.  If it's a hot day or you're just trying to do something different, I'd say it's worth a look.  You could also buy a package to go here, Ripley's Believe It or Not, and the wax museum.

151253276.name: MORE THAN JUST AN AQUARIUM AT THIS LOCATION
151253276.author: a TripAdvisor user
151253276.reviewBody: The aquarium is located within a large shopping complex. There is also a two story game room at one end that has lots of stuff like pinball machines & varias games where you can win tickets to exchange for small items. I would give the game room five stars.

151103291.name: Wow! this place is amazing!
151103291.author: a TripAdvisor user
151103291.reviewBody: This was my 2nd visit to the aquarium. First of all, this is the largest aquarium in Mexico.  Second, they have a new interactive exhibit with the dolphins.  You can choose from several different options which makes this affordable for most people.  My family had a great time seeing the dolphins up close.  I highly recommend it!

148922034.name: Fun!
148922034.author: a TripAdvisor user
148922034.reviewBody: Fun place, especially for kids. Well maintained. Reasonablly priced, but watch out for the $400 peso adventure tour as it means you suit up and feed the sharks by hand! No kidding.

148752861.name: Not so worthy if you have visited big aquariums.
148752861.author: a TripAdvisor user
148752861.reviewBody:
I was very sad to see many tanks with not so clean water. I did not see many species, and there are so many amazing and beautiful fish and sea animals in Veracruz to chose from, yet the aquarium had so little of them.

People seem to cram in such little spaces. You can tell they have not taken much care of the building, the tanks...........but animals inside seemed happy or tranquil.

I am not into zoos or aquariums, I am more into animals in nature. I have seen incredible aquariums like the on in Monterey, CA or Vancouver, Canada. This one in Veracruz, I am sorry to say is kind of boring and dissapointing.

Sorry Veracruz, because I love you.

148009332.name: One of the best aquariums in Latin America
148009332.author: a TripAdvisor user
148009332.reviewBody: This is a very large aquarium compared with many others (don\'t expect it to be better than the Georgia Aquarium but better then the Houston Aquarium) it has been constantly remodeled to offer visitors the best experience possible and now is more interactive than ever.\n\nIt is located in a shopping mall which I personally don\'t like, the parking lot is expensive and small but you can park on the streets close by (if it is summer heat and sunburn might be a concern), but overall it is worth visiting.

146105867.name: Fantastic place
146105867.author: a TripAdvisor user
146105867.reviewBody: My wife and I had a great time at the Aquarium of Veracruz.  It is a very high quality place at a very economical price - about $8 each for entry.  The variety of sea creatures is very impressive.  The presentation of the sea life is interesting, being able to walk around and under the displays.  The live dolphin show was excellent and for a fairly costly amount you can swim with the dolphins (about $70 each person for 35 minutes).   It\'s a great place to visit!

134868066.name: Met my expectations.
134868066.author: a TripAdvisor user
134868066.reviewBody: It is a nice modern aquarium, it has lots of sealife from the golf area and it is an interesting and fun activity to do while in Veracruz.\nThe only downside is the "mall" itself, it is cheese and ugly but the great great upside is that you can see the sharks and even feed them in a cage(box)  inside of the main tank ,and for only $350 pesos, that is a bargain and a great experience to have.  July 2011.

133894148.name: Not That Spectacular
133894148.author: a TripAdvisor user
133894148.reviewBody: I wanted to like this so much more than I did; it is hailed as the largest aquarium in Central/South America. It was smaller than I ever expected it to be - basically a freshwater area and a salt water area, and it\'s in a shopping mall! Yeah there are sharks: big deal. If you\'re in the US, the aquarium on Baltimore\'s Harbor is better than this one.

131446720.name: great for kids, better than expected
131446720.author: a TripAdvisor user
131446720.reviewBody: a beautifully presented aquarium, with simple to read explanations in attractive settings.  great on hot days.

130284591.name: Nice aquarium  fun for children
130284591.author: a TripAdvisor user
130284591.reviewBody: A lot of species. A lot of people too in sunday.\nBetter during the week. \n

126304977.name: World Class Aquarium
126304977.author: a TripAdvisor user
126304977.reviewBody: A thoroughly enjoyable experience at a bargain price. Beautiful modern aquarium with a great dolphin show. Amazing variety of fish from around the world. Best attraction in Veracruz.

125732828.name: so so place
125732828.author: a TripAdvisor user
125732828.reviewBody: comparing with another  acuarium  around world is small but is the best in mexico

125604521.name: \u221aery interesting
125604521.author: a TripAdvisor user
125604521.reviewBody: Diversity of marine life, sample of specimens, sharks, jellyfish, manatees, reef tank. Also swim with dolphins.

124547107.name: small and simple
124547107.author: a TripAdvisor user
124547107.reviewBody: was a small aquarium and simple nice gift shop\nreally enjoyed watching people swim with the dolphins

123763786.name: Fish eye view
123763786.author: a TripAdvisor user
123763786.reviewBody: Walking through a glass tunnel with so many different fish swimming over you. One normally doesn\'t see that much variance in fish in one place when scuba diving.

123457150.name: The dolphin display is worth the visit
123457150.author: a TripAdvisor user
123457150.reviewBody: Most presentations are in English along with Spanish. I found the displays attractive but I felt crowded as I made my way along. If you love tropical fish then this is the place. There is a dolphin display outside. I enjoyed the various tricks they did. I am not sure of a schedule for the dolphin presentation, I just sat and waited for the trainers to come and work with the dolphins. As you leave you can view the dolphins under water which is cool to see. In the same complex there are other attractions such as Scary things and Believe or not but I never bought a ticket for these attractions. If you have youngsters along these attractions could fill your day.

122914969.name: Good - but could be so much better
122914969.author: a TripAdvisor user
122914969.reviewBody: The Aquarium is very good. Staff were interested and helpful, and the shape, size and quality of the Aquarium made it a nice visit.\nHowever, the Aquarium is inside a "shopping centre" which seems to have been stuck in time somewhere in the 70\'s. Dark and dreary. it is a real pity, I wonder how many people have been discouraged of going into the Aquarium when they saw where it was. Don\'t!, Go in!

121459575.name: Fabulous aquarium
121459575.author: a TripAdvisor user
121459575.reviewBody: Great attraction, lots of fish beautifully displayed.  Reasonable entry fee.  Highly recommend.

120741569.name: Nice
120741569.author: a TripAdvisor user
120741569.reviewBody: Enjoyed our visit to the aquarium with my 5 year old.\nVery interesting, also went to the wax museum which we also enjoyed very much.\nNot the usual sights we visit when in Mexico, but with a small child, you sometimes have to keep them happy too.

119878702.name: Worth a visit
119878702.author: a TripAdvisor user
119878702.reviewBody: The aquarium was interesting and well presented. Many signs and presentations are in English. Would definitely recommend a visit.

103941472.name: Definitely worth a visit
103941472.author: a TripAdvisor user
103941472.reviewBody: The acquarium houses many interesting fishes, including several types of sharks, electric rays, dolphins, manatees, reef fishes and big turtles. The acquiarium is in excellent conditions, very clean and with activities for children. We\'ve spent 3 hours there without even noticing... In March 2011 an adult ticket costed 95 pesos, but it\'s worth it.\nAnother tip - we liked a lot the ice-cream shop in the acquarium shopping center, very good quality of ice-cream and clean.

89529629.name: Fun and lots to see
89529629.author: a TripAdvisor user
89529629.reviewBody: We weren\'t sure about going to the Aquarium (Acuario) in Veracruz but we did and we had a really good time. It was larger than we expected and you go from room to room and there\'s much to learn and see. To get there you need to walk along the malecon or walkway that heads south from the center of town. I will guess it\'s a full mile there or close to two KMs. Walking along the malecon was nice but we were there in November so it was only warm and not terribly hot. The aquarium is set in a huge facility with some other sites including shopping and dining and more. You had to pay but it was less expensive for both the young and old. Although we are gringos they gave us the old folks price. The sharks were interesting to watch and so were the dolphins on the top level and we got there just in time for a show. There were lots of different sea creatures to watch and some videos and posters with information. It was very worthwhile and we were glad we visited it.

37532341.name: A great place to spend time - un lugar ideal para pasar un rato
37532341.author: a TripAdvisor user
37532341.reviewBody: The aquarium is a great place to spend some time while you are visiting Veracruz, it\u00b4s ideal for family trips because it offers entertainment for everyone, the admission fee isn\u00b4t expensive and if you are a teacher, student, or elder (over 60 years old) you can get a discount. Plus, it offers the opportunity to feed the sharks while you are immerse inside a glass cage. There are also other attractions at the mall where the aquarium is located such as the wax museum where you will see some of the most representative mexican characters as well as some international icons like the beattles and President Obama.

22893970.name: El aquario de veracruz
22893970.author: a TripAdvisor user
22893970.reviewBody: It is really in expensive. Its the largest aquarium of mexico and central america. they also have a wax museum next to the aquarium. It has replicas of many inportant latino celebs like vicente fernandez and politcal such as former president of mexico vicente fox you can even find fidel castro in there and george w bush . They have many nice shops for souvenirs . They also have vips which is a great place to eat. If you go behind the aquarium you will have a great view of the water. If you have children there is a train you can ride and other small vehicles for kids to ride. You may also catch a glimpse of local kids skateboarding near the rocks .

1537054.name: Aquario muy bien!
1537054.author: a TripAdvisor user
1537054.reviewBody: lovely aquarium, great viewing, was crowded, very popular with locals(Xmas eve), affordable,walkable for seniors and strollers, no shows(that I know of), clever layout, can be done in as little as one hour, if necessary, not huge.

970346.name: sea-life / sea-side / seafood
970346.author: a TripAdvisor user
970346.reviewBody: Aquarium.... on boulevard Camacho, alongside the gulf. Total complex loctaed inside an air conditioned mall, lots of small shops, VIPs restaurant and several other options for eating.. (good food) Located next door is the cities most popular beach.... playa del Mar.... tables, chairs, umbrellas, food and refreshments..Whether it be the beach, or air conditioning your looking for, its a great place to spend some time, especially on a hot day!

491377408.name: Beautiful beach!
491377408.author: a TripAdvisor user
491377408.reviewBody: We went snorkeling to the nearby reef. We saw beautfiul coral and colored fish. It was very beautiful.\nWe also went to the sand dunes on a 4x4 moto. It was fun.

583204922.name: Don\'t go by your self unless you have a guide
583204922.author: a TripAdvisor user
583204922.reviewBody: It was the dirties beach you could ever see. People drinking and eating, and leaving garbage all al over with out any authority controlling this wild behavior. Fortunately we rented a nice clean hours, and hired a local excursions company to enjoy some sand boarding in the beautiful dunes

496017002.name: Disappointing
496017002.author: a TripAdvisor user
496017002.reviewBody: Went on a cloudy day so there were very few people there. You get a parking spot and a table, chairs and umbrella for free provided you purchase food and drinks. The beach and surf compare to Galveston. The food was okay. There were too many stray dogs roaming around. I doubt I\'ll ever go back.

462979217.name: Authentic Mexican beach experience
462979217.author: a TripAdvisor user
462979217.reviewBody: A typical beach full of typical Mexican beach experiences.  You can "rent" a table by buying drinks and foods from a vendor.  They come to your table and offer seafood and drinks.  We had wonderful drinks served in pineapples.  Lots of different kinds of vendors come to your table as well.  It\'s a pleasant way to experience the beach. Take a taxi from town.

444622064.name: Good fun, but don\'t expect anything relaxing
444622064.author: a TripAdvisor user
444622064.reviewBody: The beach was dirty and the sea unappealing. Most of the people parked their cars on the beach and blasted reggaeton from the speakers all afternoon. There is also the constant sound of motorbikes and quads whizzing past you. Then you get the local vendors selling crap every 30 seconds. They are not rude or anything, I just find it frustrating. This beach is great if you want to hire a quad or motorbike and ride through the dunes then return for a beer, and it\'s really cheap. But if you want sunbathing and relaxing, go somewhere else.

343159217.name: Beautiful place I loved it
343159217.author: a TripAdvisor user
343159217.reviewBody: I was here in a January day.  Not too many people. The ir was so clean and crisp. I saw the sun set in the mountains and the moon rise from the Ocean. Can it get any better?

325697674.name: Hidden gem of a beach!
325697674.author: a TripAdvisor user
325697674.reviewBody: Love this clean and little known to foreigners beach. It terms of local beaches this one is definitely the cleanest due to its location north of Veracruz (City). If you\'re into guided fauna-watching-boat rides, you\'ll find plenty of opportunities to do so here. A nice set up of a table, chairs and patio umbrella included when you purchase from the beach restaurants.

252958088.name: Amazing outdoors adventure
252958088.author: a TripAdvisor user
252958088.reviewBody: We rented quad bikes and had a fantatic time there, even though it was raining during half of our stay. Simple accomodations nearby but that shouldn\'t be an issue if you\'re the outdoorsy type.

245767083.name: Fun Experience!
245767083.author: a TripAdvisor user
245767083.reviewBody:
The beach is nothing out of the ordinary for a beach in the Gulf.

The four-wheeler ride, though, is super nice!  It is not that expensive considering you are out there about 2 hours.  The coastline is very beautiful and there are no swimming guests as far out as the ATVs go, so you get to enjoy the views even more.  

The ATVs are guided through sand dunes.  The dunes are semi-divided into a section that is more kid friendly (not as steep), versus the "wild" section where I would not go with my 6 year old.

After the dunes, there is a "forrest" section that you drive through.  There are some cows, who are so skinny, you feel hungry for them.

223048985.name: Just a local beach
223048985.author: a TripAdvisor user
223048985.reviewBody: This beach is good enough if you live nearby, but not if you have to take a plane to get there. I think it\u00b4s good enough to go for the weekend, but not to stay for a whole week.

219531206.name: Great experience out of season
219531206.author: a TripAdvisor user
219531206.reviewBody: Impressive sea and dunes, with no tourists (especially no foreigners) around. It is possible to take some hiking paths behind the dunes in a small forest. We enjoyed the nature, tasty food in the only one open bar and warm, powerfull sea waves.

188623666.name: Beautiful
188623666.author: a TripAdvisor user
188623666.reviewBody: Really pretty, if you are willing to walk a while to get away from the long open stretches where ATV\'s wail up and down the beach.

582718470.name: Fun
582718470.author: a TripAdvisor user
582718470.reviewBody: It was a fun wax museum. Especially the terror area which many Mexicans seemed reluctant to enter. I was the only one I saw go through. Some of the people are very well done. Really went to that area for the Aquarium.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Manuel Avila Camacho S/N P laza Acuario local No. 1

487506602.name: It\'s OK.
487506602.author: a TripAdvisor user
487506602.reviewBody: Nothing to write about but in this tourist attraction starved town, something to do, especially on a rainy day.  Few interesting figures and some fun pics.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Manuel Avila Camacho S/N P laza Acuario local No. 1

403422595.name: Kind of small but good
403422595.author: a TripAdvisor user
403422595.reviewBody: As with any some of the figures are dead on and some suck. Obviously filled with Mexican people like Cantinflas and Salma Hayek nd athletes and musicians and ex presidents. Also some International heavy weights like Brad Pitt and Elton John and Shakira.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Manuel Avila Camacho S/N P laza Acuario local No. 1

281969885.name: Ok it is fun
281969885.author: a TripAdvisor user
281969885.reviewBody: They are really bad made. If there was no name on the wax people I had to guess. The only fun thing is the horror section. Go check it out

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Manuel Avila Camacho S/N P laza Acuario local No. 1

278181472.name: Worth a look
278181472.author: a TripAdvisor user
278181472.reviewBody: My husband and I signed up for this along with the aquarium tickets and the other museum (ripleys). If you are only looking to go to two of them then go to the aquarium and this one. It may be different with kids, they might enjoy Ripley\'s more but we thought the wax museum was pretty good quality. We had a lot of laughs, some of the figurines are so realistic that you are kind of scared to take a picture with them, seems like they might move at any second!\n\nThere is a good variety, both Mexican, American and international figures are represented pretty equally. Everything from historical figures to politicians, to pop icons of this era. The terror section was actually really scary to walk through but you don\'t have to, you can opt out and walk around it. We had fun taking pictures of each other and marveling at the workmanship.  Glad we went!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Manuel Avila Camacho S/N P laza Acuario local No. 1

261652003.name: Fun to take pictures
261652003.author: a TripAdvisor user
261652003.reviewBody: I have seen better wax museums in Amsterdam, but this was also a very nice place to look at celebrities and learn more of the Mexican culture. I was able to take some very fun pictures with JB and the whole crew of the "El Chavo" show.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Manuel Avila Camacho S/N P laza Acuario local No. 1

233777292.name: 3 days with  the family
233777292.author: a TripAdvisor user
233777292.reviewBody: great afternoob with the family many items & people in wax done very well also a 1955 rolls royce in perfect shape & lots of thing to for you to do hands on good fun

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Manuel Avila Camacho S/N P laza Acuario local No. 1

231826205.name: Some worldly famous people there
231826205.author: a TripAdvisor user
231826205.reviewBody: It was okay, not to big and we didn\'t know a good amount of the figures. Still nice to take up some time and to be out of the heat.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Manuel Avila Camacho S/N P laza Acuario local No. 1

178860355.name: Good wax figures
178860355.author: a TripAdvisor user
178860355.reviewBody: Good wax figures, but a lot of people inside, they need to have more control over the amount of people entering

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Manuel Avila Camacho S/N P laza Acuario local No. 1

177561095.name: Boring
177561095.author: a TripAdvisor user
177561095.reviewBody: The place is boring, you can buy the ticket with the aquarium and ripley\'s musseum but is worthless, the "statues" are awful without details, there are only a few.\n\nOnly go if you want to waste 1 hour... top.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Manuel Avila Camacho S/N P laza Acuario local No. 1

547022188.name: A master piece of Mexican History, you shall not miss it
547022188.author: a TripAdvisor user
547022188.reviewBody: If you want to learn about what the life-in-the-sea means then you should pay a visit to this amazing out of service boat, the boat itself is very interesting to see but the explanation from the boat keeper makes the experience full of stories, he is very skilled on all about the boat as he is a former Army element

344357614.name: Rather uninteresting :(
344357614.author: a TripAdvisor user
344357614.reviewBody: There are a few rooms to visit,  and the guide spoke fast and was difficult to understand. Mostly obvious explanations: "this is the rap to communicate"... There is a short video,  also of low quality. The museum is supposed to be interactive, but aside from randomly pushing the buttons of a long dead radio, I did not sees any evidence of interactivity. \nWhen I asked the guide hire to use the sextant,  he used it sideways! Not vertical. \nWaste of time!

343159515.name: Love it delicious food
343159515.author: a TripAdvisor user
343159515.reviewBody: This place is great. It seat in a beautiful marina and their food is wonderful. I really like it and it is very well price.

250103619.name: Great ship to visit
250103619.author: a TripAdvisor user
250103619.reviewBody: If you are expecting something similar to the US military vessel you\'ll be disappointed. This is an old Mexican ship which served well to the Mexican military. It was trade with grains some 80 years ago.\nThe history tells us a lot about it. From what I hear it depends on the guide that you get. I would suggest to look for Teodoro Sanchez. He is a great guide who actually worked at the ship several years ago.\n

233208841.name: That ship is great!
233208841.author: a TripAdvisor user
233208841.reviewBody: I enjoyed my time on that ship.\nOur guide, Mr Pedro is great. He knows every corner of that boat and let you know what happened with that boat when it was on service.\nThakn you Mr Pedro for your time!

223069767.name: The best!
223069767.author: a TripAdvisor user
223069767.reviewBody: It has a really interesting history, the tourist guides are kind and funny.. It\'s also cheap! The entrance is 56 pesos and they show you a lot of places inside... The view is great from the restaurant. I highly recommend this  place .

206849616.name: Run down and lacking enthusiasm.
206849616.author: a TripAdvisor user
206849616.reviewBody: From a distance, the old ship looks great. But upon arrival and closer inspection, it is in a rather poor state of affairs. More restaurant than museum, there isn\'t much here to see. Better to spend your time in the cute town of Boca communicating with the locals. Or go to the main square to people watch. Definitely not worth the trip all the way here if you are in downtown Veracruz.

148009272.name: Good museum/restaurant
148009272.author: a TripAdvisor user
148009272.reviewBody: It\'s not a great museum and it has no air conditioning but is an interesting your after which you can have a nice meal.

117003725.name: If you have ever been on a real Naval vessel you\'ll be disappointed...
117003725.author: a TripAdvisor user
117003725.reviewBody: The local fishermen were displaced and this old, rusting gunboat built some 80 years ago in Spain, was towed in as a business enterprise. Without a corps of volunteers it\'s impossible to maintain a ship like this - many are scrapped for that very reason. It looks salvaged: rusted and modified with an odd superstructure that looks like a chicken coop but is actually a restaurant, it\'s nothing like the retired vessels on display in the U.S. which are maintained by devoted cadres of retired servicemen and volunteers. If you want to see military vessels head down to the Port and see the real thing - for free.

649030385.name: Entertaining
649030385.author: a TripAdvisor user
649030385.reviewBody: It is fantastic that people still keep these traditions alive. Seemingly simple but a dangerous feat for these men. Even going up the pole would be impossible for most of us much less falling head first slowly to the ground. Costumes are also very colourful and beautifully stitched. Very entertaining.

618340596.name: Meh
618340596.author: a TripAdvisor user
618340596.reviewBody: I am sure that there are plenty of people who find or would find these voladores fascinating. I am not one of them. Watching a bunch of guys circle a pole is boring.

561811068.name: magic moments watching the flyers of papantla
561811068.author: a TripAdvisor user
561811068.reviewBody: We watched los Voladores of Papantla three times!  Twice outside of El Tajin, and once in Papantla city center.  There are several performances per day, and the suggested donation runs from 20 to 50 pesos (higher for foreigners).  The performance runs approx. 30 mins.  It is good to have binoculars.  There is no information given out on the ritual except for what you can find on the internet.  A definite must see!

509073600.name: Out of this world
509073600.author: a TripAdvisor user
509073600.reviewBody: Seeing the Voladores is an unique experience. You can\'t miss it if you travel to Veracruz. El Tajin is a majestuous place and is full with history...there\'s so much to see!

491293944.name: Just Amazing
491293944.author: a TripAdvisor user
491293944.reviewBody: We went to Papantla it was amazing actually breathtaking to see.  \nIt was sunny although crowded yet we mesmerised by the Los Voladores.

459674130.name: A touch of the prehispanic time
459674130.author: a TripAdvisor user
459674130.reviewBody: The flyers of Papantla are a representation of what is believed was part of a ceremony, the people from Tajin are known as the people of wind, it requires a lot of skills to participate in this representation.

454111184.name: The kind of thing foreigners are execting to see
454111184.author: a TripAdvisor user
454111184.reviewBody: You have to see this event. Besides it being a historical performance to nature its a fantastic show of bravery. I can only say that its the kind of attraction that you will only find at Veracruz. Of course you have to visit el Tajin on your same trip to the Voladores.

441716077.name: Papantla charming, flyers mildly interesting.
441716077.author: a TripAdvisor user
441716077.reviewBody: Stopped in Papantla otw to Tajin. Charming town, interesting mural. Flyers performance just a small piece of the bigger picture. Don\'t hang around just to see it. It\'s done also at Tajin.

395987840.name: A must see event!
395987840.author: a TripAdvisor user
395987840.reviewBody: We saw this show by the pyramids at El Tajin, and again in the city of Papantla near the church in the zocalo. They put on an amazing show, and we were impressed by how gracefully they performed this dangerous and historic ceremony.

367537645.name: Interesting historic performance
367537645.author: a TripAdvisor user
367537645.reviewBody: An historic ritual performance that is best viewed after a trip to El Tajin and reading about the historical significance.  Beautiful to watch.

351115734.name: Amazing Flying Dancers
351115734.author: a TripAdvisor user
351115734.reviewBody: This is one of the more amazing things we experienced during our trip to the Veracruz region. Having 4 men launching themselves down, tied to a rope and twirling upside down to the music of a flute played by a 5th man dancing on top of the 30 meter pole, was exhilarating. It made our 4 hour trip to Tajin even more worthwhile.

345044117.name: Quick and fun
345044117.author: a TripAdvisor user
345044117.reviewBody: We caught this in Paplanto and I think beginning to end, it was about 20 minutes.  Our guide had told us the cost would be 30 MXP.  Someone tried to charge me 50 MXP and I refused so they accepted the 30 MXP.  Record a video with your cell phone.  The performers will happily do group photos after the event is over.

344841184.name: a superb attraction
344841184.author: a TripAdvisor user
344841184.reviewBody: Traditional people fly around a standing pole. It was a traditional performance but now the demonstrate it several times a day.

334662102.name: Before Bungee-Jumping, There Were Voladores
334662102.author: a TripAdvisor user
334662102.reviewBody:
Probably the best place to catch this spectacle is at the Cathedral of Our Lady of the Ascension, just next to the main square of Papantla de Olarte.

Basically, five men climb a tall vertical pole. While one plays the pipes, the other four jump off the top (with ropes attached, of course), and spin around as the rope slowly elongates. Each man goes around 13 times, multiplied by 4 is 52 (the weeks in a year).

This is part of the ancient fertility rite, which is quite a spectacle to witness. Yes, they do it now more for the tourists than anything, I expect, but it is quite something, especially when you realise that there are no safety nets...

300682244.name: Incredible!
300682244.author: a TripAdvisor user
300682244.reviewBody: Very, very good show!    We were there for the day to see the ruins.   Wonderful place to see!   Show is about once per hour or so.   A tip is requested, and about 50 pesos per person.

277633160.name: Pretty cool
277633160.author: a TripAdvisor user
277633160.reviewBody: Very talented men that do this act.  Quite interesting to see the different cultures and rituals.  I would definitely return.

270669249.name: Often replicated, but Papantla is the original
270669249.author: a TripAdvisor user
270669249.reviewBody: If you are in Papntla you must watch the Voladores (fliers). The ceremony is rich in history, an ancient test of bravery to appeas the gods. But today a viberant ceremony to remember an ancient tradition. You can see the Voladores in Mexico City ( museum of anthropology and the piramids of Teotihucan, but Papantla is the origin and a better photo op with the gorgeous church in the background. Please support them with some pesos, viewing is for free but donations are greatly appreciated. The complete ceremony takes awhile 20 minutes, which can be rough on a hot day. But the show is worth the wait. Read a little more bout the significance to get a better appreciation. You can get a photo witha Voladore after the show for 10 pesos and by a replica toy.

264289865.name: You Won\'t Believe Your Eyes
264289865.author: a TripAdvisor user
264289865.reviewBody: We\'ve seen the Voladords a couple of times at the Tlaxcala Feria.  They are a sight to behold!  If you get the chance, don\'t miss them!

263256674.name: If in Papantla, you must watch them
263256674.author: a TripAdvisor user
263256674.reviewBody: We sat on the steps of the church on the plaza where the flyers\' pole is erected. The flyers circle the pole playing their flutes.  Then four of them climb, wrap their ropes around the top of the pole, and are joined by a fifth who perches on the very top of the pole.  Down come the four flyers, upside down, still playing their flutes and circling until they land.  It\'s a free show with contributions accepted.  Why not watch?

257355326.name: Saw these guys at Tajin. Unique and worthwhile show.
257355326.author: a TripAdvisor user
257355326.reviewBody: Saw the voladores putting on there show at the Mayan ruins of Tajin (which are also a worthwhile visit). Their show lasts about 20 mins and is quite impressive to see what they do for a living. Also their costumes cost an incredible amount of money and overall the whole show and story is well worth the effort to go see them.
